He works at his business every day and he only rests on Sundays. With time, he has had success gaining customers who like the sweets he prepares. This business makes Ricardo happy because it allows him to meet more people. He has decided to increases his working capital and to improve the infrastructure of his business. With his first loan with MFP, he has many expectations of how this new experience with the communal bank will be. He has positive references and he promises to be a responsible member with his payments. With the loan he is requesting, he will invest the money in consumables and ingredients for his business.

loans.use: to purchase consumables and products to prepare more bread and cakes.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene   03 hijos.  Vive en casa propia con su conviviente, dicha casa está ubicada en el Caserío Amaru Inca Valle de los Inca en el distrito de  Tambogrande en Piura al norte del Perú.  Josefa vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Josefa se dedica  a la crianza de chanchos y pavos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años en los que ha adquirido experiencia en el rubro.   Josefa cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos. Los animales cuando alcanzan tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local.

Complementariamente se dedica a la agricultura, pues su madre le ha dado en herencia 1.0 has de terreno agrícola, en el cual tiene limón en producción y lo cosecha semanalmente.
Su conviviente es trabajador estable en otra zona agricola y con su sueldo asume los gastos familiares.

Josefa está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, para  que pueda comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales y para la implementación de un nuevo corral para sus animales. 

Josefa, es una clienta conocida por Edpyme Alternativa, presenta un buen record de pagos, demostrando de esta manera su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Josefa is the 29-year-old mother of a family. She lives with her partner and has three children. They live in their own house, which is located in the little village of Amaru Inca Valle de los Inca in the district of Tambogrande in Piura, in the northern part of Peru. Josefa lives in the rural part of this district and does not have basic services.

Josefa raises hogs and turkeys. She has been doing this for 6 years, and in this time she has acquired experience in this work. She has appropriate and spacious enclosures. When the animals reach the ideal size and weight, she sells them in the local market.

At the same time, she works in agriculture, since her mother has given her an inheritance of 1.0 hectares of agricultural land, on which she produces lemons and harvests them weekly. Her partner is a regular worker in another agricultural area and with his earnings assumes the family's expenses.

Josefa is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 PEN so that she can buy balanced feed for her animals and set up a new enclosure for them.

Josefa is a client who is known by Edpyme Alternativa. She has a good record of payments and in this way shows her sense of responsibility.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and construct an enclosure for her animals

loans.name: Miguel Arcangel

texts.es: El Sr. Miguel   tiene  una tienda  de  abarrotes  desde hace ya  ocho  años en  la  cual  trabaja   la  mayor  parte  del  día , en esta  ocasión requiere  del  crédito para  realizar  la  compra  de mercancía ya  que  requiere  brindar  a  sus  clientes  una  mayor  variedad  de   productos e  incrementar  sus  ingresos , agradece  a la  institución ya  que  ayudara  a  hacer  realidad  su proyecto.
texts.en: For the past eight years Miguel has been working each day in his grocery store. This time he is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise so that he can provide his customers with a greater variety of products. In this way he will increase his earnings. He is thankful for the institution that will help him attain his goals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Elisa Aurora

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del cantón Santa Ana se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Amigas Por Siempre. Este lugar es conocido por su vegetación pero sobre todo por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por turistas locales y de otras partes del país.

En este hermoso lugar conocimos a la señora Elisa, tiene 50 años de edad y está casada. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y a la agricultura. Lleva en el Banco Comunal 9 ciclos y está muy contenta por los beneficios que ha recibido en este tiempo y porque en el grupo ha hecho muchas amigas que le hacen olvidar a veces  los problemas que tiene.

Es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo en los trabajos y gastos del hogar realiza el crédito tanto para su esposo como para ella. Ella se dedica a la cría de gallinas también ayuda a su  marido en los trabajos del campo ya que ellos siembran maíz, yuca, plátano y verduras, aprovechan que el río pasa por la finca de ellos y esto les permite realizar sembríos en toda época del año, trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 13h00, las verduras y productos cundo están de cosecha los llevan a entregar a Santa Ana  a los mercados de esta ciudad.

Este nuevo crédito es para  comprar pollos ya que quiere hacer una pequeña granja en su casa y criar mayor cantidad de pollos.
 
Sus metas son seguir trabajando y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The “Friends Forever” Community Bank meets every fifteen days in the Ayacucho Parish in the Santa Ana Canton. An area known for its vegetation, its greatest draw is its beautiful fresh water thermal baths that are visited by local tourists and people from other parts of the country. 
In this pretty place we find Mrs. Elisa, who is 50 years old and married. Her husband is a bricklayer and a farmer. She has participated in nine cycles with the Community Bank. She is satisfied with the benefits she has currently received. She has made many friends who sometimes help her forget the problems that she has. She is a good housewife. In order to help her husband with his work and the household expenses she is requesting this loan for her husband as well as herself. She raises chickens and she also helps her husband on the farm where they grow corn, yucca (an edible root), platanos (starchy bananas), and vegetables. They are lucky that a river runs through their farm, which allows them to grow crops all year long. They work each day from 6am until 1pm. At harvest time they bring their vegetables and products to the Santa Ana market in their city.
This new loan will be used to buy chickens. They want to make a small chicken coop next to their house in order to raise a greater number of chickens.
Their goals are to continue working and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna tiene 45 años, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo en su casa propia. DesD. hace 11 años tiene su granja D. animales, espacio donD. cría cuyes y gallinas, en el que son vendidos, ya sea en el mercado o como también en momentos festivos, que es cuando venD. más D. lo normal. ElL. siempre compra animales para así abastecerse D. capital D. trabajo, además las crías que tiene le da una buena alimentación para así alcanzar un peso exacto para que puedan ser vendidos a un buen precio. En ocasiones sus hijos L. apoyan en el negocio, transportando animales. Este negocio le ha permitido mejorar L. economía D. su hogar por lo que desea ampliar el espacio D. su granja para criar más animales. Es su crédito número 14 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita,  comprará más animales y nuevos galpones D. madera.
texts.en:
Reyna, 45, lives with her two children and her husband in her own house.  For the last 11 years she’s had an animal farm, a space where she raises guinea pigs and chickens, which are sold either in the market or during festive occasions which is when she sells more than normal.  She always buys animals to stock up on working capital.  She feeds the young well so that they will reach an exact weight that will allow them to be sold for good prices.  This business has allowed her to improve her household economy so she wants to expand her farm’s space to raise more animals.

This is loan #14 that she has with MFP and she’s very happy to know that she can count on financial support because she’s always shown herself to be responsible with her payments.  Besides, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people.

She thanks all those who will fund the loan she’s requesting that will be very useful for her business’ progress.  She will use the requested loan to buy more animals and new wooden sheds.

loans.use: to buy more animals and wooden sheds.

loans.name: Segundo Valeriano

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 65 años de edad, él es casado sin hijos a su cargo.  Vive en casa propia con su esposa. Su casa está ubicada en el caserío Paccha en el distrito de Chulucanas en Piura al norte del Perú. Cliente vive en la parte céntrica de este distrito y cuentan con los servicios básicos.

Segundo se dedica  a la crianza de ganado porcino y ovino, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local y con vecinos de su localidad.
Segundo también de desenvuelve como agricultor,  tiene 3.0 hectáreas  de terreno agrícola herencia de sus padres, pero ya cuenta con toda la documentación a su nombre, en dicha parcela tiene sembrado Mango 1.50 de hectáreas  y ha instalado 0.50 hectáreas  de fríjol chileno, ambos cultivos bien conducidos. Segundo cuenta con más de 15 años  experiencia en la agricultura.

Segundo esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles los que destinará la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales y así obtener mayor peso y tamaño.  De esta manera lograr mayor precio en sus animales en el mercado. 

Segundo, es un cliente nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa. Sin embrago ya ha manejado diferentes préstamos y reporta un buen historial crediticio. Segundo presenta buenas referencias personales. Sus vecinos y personas que lo conocen lo describen como una persona muy responsable y respetuosa.
texts.en:
Segundo, 65, is married and does not have any children in his care.  He lives in his own house with his wife.  His house is located in the Paccha hamlet in Chulucanas District in Piura in northern Perú.  The client lives in the central part of this district and they have basic utilities.

Segundo raises pigs and sheep which, when they reach ideal size and weight, he sells at the local market and among local neighbors.  He’s also a farmer.  He has 3 hectares of farmland which was passed down to him by his parents but which he now has legal title to.  He has 1.5 hectares planted with mango and 0.5 hectares with Chilean beans; both crops are doing well.  Segundo has over 15 years experience in farming.

Segundo is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed in order to attain larger size and weight so that he can get better sale prices for his animals in the market.

Segundo is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa.  However, he has managed other loans and has good credit history.  His neighbors and people who know him describe him as a very responsible, respectful person.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Amparo Filomena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Amparo, tiene 45 años de edad, hace varios años atrás su esposo falleció pero de esta relación tuvo seis hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive con un nieto que tiene 2 años y que es como su hijo porque lo crio desde pequeño.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, nos cuenta que también trabaja a base de pedidos que le realizan con anticipación. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00  hasta las 13h00, deja a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o cuando necesite. Lleva siete años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. Nos cuenta que le gusta lo que hace ya que así se olvida un poco de su soledad y además se gana el sustento diario.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  siete años y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito que recibió de la institución pudo empezar en su negocio.

Su sueño es tener un almacén donde pueda vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres de Lucha (Hard-working Women) meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for being very commercial, for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the happiness of its people.

Here we meet Señora Amparo. She is 45 years old. Her husband died some years ago, but from this relationship she has six children, all of whom are adults and independent. A grandson who is 2 years old lives with her, and he is like her son, since she raised him since he was small.

 She sells clothing of all types. She sells door to door and also sells in her house, where her customers come. She tells us that she also works from orders that are placed in advance. She works every day from 9 am until 1 pm. She leaves products on credit and collects payments every two weeks. She goes to Guayaquil to buy merchandise every two weeks or when she needs it. She has been in this business for seven years, and it has gone very well for her. She tells us that she likes what she does since in this way she can forget her loneliness for a little while and furthermore, she earns her daily living.

She will use the loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, sport shirts, and children's clothing. She has been in the communal bank for seven years, and she likes it because thanks to the first loan that she received from the institution, she was able to begin her business.

Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar tiene 60 años D. edad, vive con su hijo y su  esposo que es director D. un colegio y le apoya con los gastos D. su hogar. Sus gastos familiares son mínimos.  Tiene casa propia en la cual viven hace 20 años y son reconocidos en la zona.

Pilar  se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza, teniendo un estante en su sala para venta directa al público, así mismo venD. a pedido efectuando cobranzas quincenalmente. Pilar cuenta con un sector D.  clientela conocida que periódicamente realizan pedidos y consumen sus productos 

Pilar esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa D. S/2,000.00 nuevos soles, para comprar un lote D. productos D. belleza, para incrementar su  mercadera tener más variedad para ofrecerle a su público y  paralelamente incrementar sus ventas.

Pilar,  es una cliente nueva  y bancarizada por Edpyme Alternativa. Pilar es una mujer empeñosa y responsable que lucha por salir adelante y obtener una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Pilar is 60 years old and lives with her son and her husband, who is a school principal and supports her with household expenses, which are minimal. They have lived in their own home for the past 20 years and are well known in the area. Pilar makes a living selling beauty products. She has a stand in one of her rooms to sell directly to the public, and she also sells on order, making collections every two weeks. Pilar has a well-known customer base that regularly makes orders and uses her products. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a batch of beauty products to expand her merchandise so she can offer a wider selection of products and at the same time increase her sales. Pilar is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa and is an earnest and responsible woman who fights to make headway and obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products to expand her merchandise.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: El Sr. Ismael es una persona muy seria y responsable  para  el cual su familia   representa  todo en su vida,  en esta  ocasión  solicita el préstamo por  que  desea  instalar  el piso de  su casa   que  esta   deteriorado, ve  en el  crédito la  posibilidad de  ofrecer  a  su  familia  una mayor  seguridad  y satisfacción, agradece a   la   institución el  apoyo para   realizar  su sueño realidad.
texts.en: Ismael is a very serious and responsible person. His family means everything to him. At this time, he is asking for the loan because he wants to install a floor in his home, since the floor it has has deteriorated. He sees in the loan the possibility of offering his family more security and satisfaction. He is thankful to the institution for its support in making his dreams come true.

loans.use: to install a floor in his home.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea B. is a Zumba instructor and the owner of Intone Dance Studio in Corpus Christi, Texas.  When Andrea first started taking Zumba classes, she realized “this is how I wanted to keep exercising.”  Andrea, who is Colombian-American, likes how Zumba combines exercise with Latin dance rhythms.  A year and a half ago, Andrea became a certified Zumba instructor, prompting her to leave her career as a flight attendant and begin teaching classes herself.

She opened Intone Dance Studio on April 1, 2011.  In addition to Andrea, the studio has three instructors who all individually teach classes, allowing Andrea to offer classes throughout the morning and afternoon.  Many of her current students are people who followed her from the studio where she previously worked.  The students help Andrea grow the studio by recruiting friends and bringing them to class.  Though anyone can join, the majority of Andrea’s students are young and middle-aged women.  

Andrea is using this loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana to help cover initial operating costs and meet any unforeseen expenses.  She hopes to save enough of the money from this loan to upgrade the studio’s sound system once the business gets through the first few startup months.  For supplemental income, Andrea rents out the studio for special events such as baby showers.

Andrea loves seeing the physical and mental transformation her students undergo as they take her classes.  She hopes to eventually expand her studio and carry workout apparel.  Andrea likes owning her own business, despite finding it stressful.  “Being your own boss is good because you can organize your time the way you want it.  But at the same time, it brings a lot of responsibility…it is a challenge.”  Andrea is married with a 16-year-old son.

loans.use: to meet operating expenses and upgrade a sound system

loans.name: María Eulalia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 22 y 18 años de edad, el menor de ellos aun  vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella tiene un local en su casa en el que se dedica a la venta productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), otros cosméticos y ciertos tratamientos para el cabellos y tinturados. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00. Mientras ella se encarga de su negocio el esposo se dedica a la venta de repuestos y refacciones para automóviles, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y  trabaja de lunes a sábados. Tanto los cosméticos como los repuestos de los vehículos los van a comprar a Guayaquil cada vez que necesitan. Nos cuenta que tienen seis años dedicados a estas actividades.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, repuestos y refacciones de vehículos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace  dos años y le gusta porque les ayuda con el negocio.
 
Sus sueños son tener un mejor negocio y mas grande.
texts.en:
The Mujeres De Lucha [Fighting Women] community bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a very commercial area and for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo and for its people's cheerfulness.  

Here we meet María. She is 44 years old and married. She has two children, aged 22 and 18. The youngest still ives with her. Her husband is a merchant.  

She has a locale in her house where she sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accesories), as well as other cosmetics and certain hair treatments and dyes. She works every day from 8:30 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. While she runs her business, her husband sells car parts. The way she makes her sales is from door to door, Monday through Saturday. They buy the cosmetics and the car parts in Guayaquil as they need them. She tells us that they have been doing this for six years.  

She is going to use this loan to buy perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics, and car parts. She has been in the community bank for two years and she likes it because it helps them with the business.
 
Her dreams are to have a bigger and better business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, replacement parts for cars.

loans.name: Dante Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 69 años de edad, es casado con la señora Maria Agapito, con la que tienen 2 hijos.  Ellos tienen casa propia y esta ubicada en la zona rural de Chacupe, en distrito de La Victoria.

Alberto se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace mas de quince años, el suele sembrar arveja en un pequeño terreno de cultivo con el que cuenta y se ubica en su misma localidad de Chacupe, en esta  zona la mayoría de pobladores se dedica a esta labor.

Alberto desea adquirir fertilizantes y abono para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de arveja con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de S/. 3000,00 nuevos soles.

Alberto es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresario y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Alberto is 69 years old. He is married to Maria Agapito and they have 2 children. They have their own house, located in the rural area of Chacupe, district of La  Victoria.

Alberto has been working in agriculture for over fifteen years. He usually grows peas in a small field he owns, also located in Chacupe. Most of people in the area do this kind of work. 

Alberto would like to buy fertilizers and manure to support his pea crop. He expects that this will bring him a good harvest. That's why he has had to request a loan of 3,000 soles to Edpyme Alternativa. 

Alberto is a rather quiet and responsible person. His greatest wish is to grow his business and get on.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for his crop.

loans.name: Latoya

texts.en:
LaToya W. owns Prosperous Staffing LLC, a business that provides staffing solutions for call centers and other businesses needing excellent customer specialists.   LaToya has hired a staff with extensive experience in customer service and LaToya herself has experience working in the call center industry.  Their combined experience gives Prosperous Staffing the know-how to be the bridge connecting the gap between employer and employee.  With many companies operating call centers in Houston, LaToya recognized the opportunity for a niche staffing agency that knows the ins and outs of the industry.  

LaToya is using this loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana to purchase business cards, brochures, workers compensation insurance, and to update her business’ website.  When LaToya first opened Prosperous Staffing in 2009, she relied solely on her savings to get the business up and running.  Looking back, she realizes that a lack of financing prevented her from starting the business with enough resources to be effective, which is why she turned to ACCION Texas-Louisiana after temporarily closing her business.   This loan gave her the means to re-launch and aggressively advertise her business.  Having just celebrated the re-launching of her business on May 2, LaToya is running her business full-time and has engaged the help of a part-time recruiter and a part time field worker.  

LaToya credits her parents with giving her the confidence to be a small business owner.  After working for years in Corporate America, she decided it was time for her to create her own opportunity.  LaToya is utilizing the business counseling services offered by the Houston Minority Supplier Diversity Council and the Women’s Business Enterprise Association for networking and instruction in business development.  LaToya’s goal is to establish Prosperous Staffing as the premier staffing agency for call centers in the greater-Houston area.  When the time comes, she will expand Prosperous Staffing to other markets where call centers have a strong presence.   

Check out LaToya’s website at http://www.prosperousstaffing.com

loans.use: to pay for business cards, brochures, workers compensation insurance, and updates to her business' website

loans.name: Claudia Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia es una persona muy respetuosa y  responsable en esta  ocasión  requiere el préstamo porque desea comprar mercancía para su negocio ya  que  actualmente ella  se  dedica  a la  venta  de ropa usada ,    ve  en el crédito la posibilidad de poder  ofrecer  una  mejor    variedad  de  productos  a  sus  clientes  así  como también    una  estabilidad  económica   a su  familia.
texts.en: Claudia is a very respectful and responsible person. She now requires a loan because she would like to buy merchandise for her business. She currently sells used clothing and she sees the loan as a chance to offer a greater variety of products to her customers, as well as to provide her family with more financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Viky Karen

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karen, tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 5 y de 1 año, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa en Picoaza en una distribuidora. Tiene tres años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que fue una amiga del banco quien la incentivó para que se dedique a estas ventas.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las charlas sobretodo las de salud.

Su sueño es tener un almacén con local propio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the "Mujeres de Lucha" community bank meets in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known as being a commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas and the cheerfulness of its people.

Here we meet 20 year-old Karen who lives with her common-law husband and has two children aged 5 and 1.  Her eldest child is in elementary school.  Her husband is a salesman.

Karen is a housewife who, in order to make her own money, also sells clothes and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories) through catalogs.  She works every day and makes her sales door to door.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment every week.  Her Avon products are delivered to her home and she buys her clothes from a distributor.  Karen has been in this business for three years and it is doing very well.  She tells us that it was a friend from her community bank who encouraged her to start selling these products.

Karen will use this loan to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and all kinds of clothes.  This is her fourth loan cycle with her community bank which she likes because of the talks, especially the health talks.

Karen's dream is to have a store located in her own premises.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora  es una madre de familia de 48 años de edad.  Vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, residen en el sector Sandoval en Motupe. Sandoval, es un sector agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Dora  se dedica  a trabajar en labores asociadas a la cría de animales menores, especialmente ovejas y cabritos  en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente cuenta con una mototaxi, que es de su propiedad y con clientela ya establecida. 

Dora desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  S/. 1500.00   nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Dora  es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Dora is a 48 year-old mother.  She lives with her husband and two children in Sandoval sector, in Motupe.  Sandoval is an agricultural sector which is located in Lambayeque province, more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Dora raises young animals, especially sheep and goats.  She raises the animals in some pens which are located near her home, feeding them grains and natural fodder.  When they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the traders who frequently visit her area.  Dora also owns a motorcycle taxi and has an established customer base.

Dora would like to acquire more animals and balanced animal feed to expand her business and make more income.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

Dora is a driven and hard-working person.  Her biggest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Manuela Marisol

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Manuela, tiene 41 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual aun no ha podido tener hijos. El marido es chofer profesional. Lleva ocho ciclos  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son fasiles conseguir.

Ella es una gran mujer que además de atender muy bien a su marido también se dedica a su negocio, tiene un local en su casa donde vende aguas, sodas, jugos, bocadillos de picar y golosinas. También se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  pequeño local, Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30  hasta las 19h00. Lo que es ropa y zapatos deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar golosinas, sodas, zapatos y  ropa de todo tipo. 

Su sueño es tener una tienda grande y bien surtida.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the "Mujeres de Lucha" community bank meets in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for being very commercial.  It is also known for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas and the cheerfulness of its people.

Here we meet 41 year-old Manuela who lives with her common-law husband.  She has not yet been able to have any children.  Her husband is a professional driver.  Manuela has been a member of her community bank for eight loan cycles and she likes her bank because the loans are easy to obtain.

Manuela is a great woman who, in addition to looking after her husband very well, also works in her own business.  She has a sales location in her home from which she sells water, soda, juice, sandwiches and candies.  She also sells all kinds of clothes and shoes.  She makes her sales door to door and also makes some sales from her small premises.  Manuela works every day from 8.30am to 7.00pm.  She leaves the clothes and shoes with her customers on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil every two weeks or every month, depending on what she needs.  She has been in this business for ten years and it is doing very well.

Manuela will use this loan to buy candies, soda, shoes and clothes.  Her dream is to have a large and well-stocked store.

loans.use: to buy candies, soda, shoes and clothes

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es:
José tiene 26  años de edad, él casado y tiene un hijo.  Vive en casa propia, la cual esta ubicada en la zona urbano marginal del distrito de Mochumi, cuenta con servicios de luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.

José se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público de pasajeros en una mototaxi (unidad móvil con moto y una cabina para transportar pasajeros), esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años en su misma localidad donde cuenta con clientes establecidos.  Además cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto de la venta de animales, labor que realiza pero con menor dedicación.

José quiere poder darle mantenimiento a su unidad móvil comprando algunos repuestos y renovado sus asientos.  Para eso a crecido por conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de S/. 1500 nuevos soles para solventar estos gastos.

José es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es salir adelante y poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 26 years old, married, and has one child.  He lives in his own home which is located in a marginal urban area in Mochumi district.  It has electricity.   His is a small community which is made up of approximately 100 families.

José provides a public transport service in his motorcycle taxi (a vehicle which consists of a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting passengers).  He has been in this business for two years and works in his own village where he has regular customers.  He also makes additional income from selling animals but this is a sideline business.

José would like to be able to have maintenance work done on his vehicle.  He would like to buy some spare parts and renew the seats.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to cover these expenses.

José is a calm and responsible person.  His biggest wish is to get ahead in life and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle and to have it serviced

loans.name: Zenaida Yessenia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Zenaida es socia fundadora del Banco comunal hace 42 ciclos y le gusta por el compañerismo que hay en el grupo. Tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 20, 15 y 10 años los mismos que estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela, todos aun  viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y además de esto también vende artículos de plástico. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, nos cuenta que este trabajo o esta forma de ganarse la vida  empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco hace muchos años y que poco a poco con los créditos ha ido creciendo más su negocio, por eso está muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir. Trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo por las mañanas o en las noches ya que es más fresco a esas horas.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y productos plásticos.

Su sueño es tener un buen almacén.
texts.en:
The Mujeres de Lucha (Tenacious Women) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parrish in the city of Portoviejo.  It is a place known for a very commercial zone, its traditional celebrations of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for its joyful people.

Zenaida is a founding member of the communal bank, which was founded 42 cycles ago.  She likes the comradeship that exists in the group.  She is 37 years old and is married.  She has three children; ages 20, 15, and 10.  The children attend the university, high school, and elementary school.  All of them still live with her.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a housewife, and in order to get her own resources she sells all types of clothes.  In addition to this, she also sells plastic items.  She sells door to door.  She tells us that she started this work or way of earning a living with the first loan she received from the bank many years ago.  Little by little she has been expanding her business with the loans.

That is why she is very grateful to the Fundación Espoir.

She works three days a week.  She works mostly in the mornings or evenings because it is cooler at those times.

Her dream is to have a good store.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, and plastic products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business, buying more gas cylinders

loans.name: María Melida

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, uno de 17 años que es un niño especial y otro 7 años que estudia en escuela. El marido es comerciante. Este es el tercer  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho tanto en su negocio como en su vida familiar.

Ella se dedica al igual que su esposo a la venta de aliños y especias, pastas de dientes, papel higiénico, entre otras cosas, ellos se desplazan por todo el centro de la ciudad sobre todo por los mercados que es donde todas las personas acuden  a hacer sus compras diarias. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 12h00, ya que a esa hora tiene que ir a preparar el almuerzo y en la tarde ayudar a su hijo en las tareas de la escuela y también a su hijo que es especial ya que en las mañanas ella lo tiene en una escuela para niños especiales es así como aprovecha las mañanas para realizar sus ventas y con esto ayuda a su esposo en la dura tarea de llevar el pan diario al hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar aliños, especias, detergentes, pastas dentales, entre otras cosas.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the "Mujeres De Lucha" community bank meets in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for being very commercial.  It is also noted for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas and the cheerfulness of its residents.

Here we meet 33 year-old María who lives with her common-law husband and has two children.  Her eldest son is 17 and is a child with special needs.  Her youngest son is 7 and in elementary school.  Her husband is a salesman.  This is María's third loan cycle as a member of her community bank.  She likes the bank because the loans have helped her a lot both in her business and also in her family life.

María and her husband both sell seasonings, spices, toothpaste, toilet paper and other products.  They travel around the whole of the city center, especially around the markets which is where everybody goes to do their daily shopping.  María works every day, from 8.00am to 12.00pm.  At midday she has to go and prepare lunch and in the afternoons she has to help her younger son with his school work.  She also has to help her child who has special needs.  In the mornings he attends a school for children with special needs and so she takes advantage of this to make her sales in the mornings and help her husband in the difficult task of making enough money to support their household.

María will use this loan to buy seasonings, spices, detergents, toothpaste and other products.  Her dream is to own a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy seasonings, spices, detergents, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
M. es un padre de familia de 47 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposa e hijos, el cual cuenta con servicio de agua y luz en el caserío Sime que se encuentra a unos 20 minutos del distritode Pitipo  y a 40 minutos de la provincia de Ferreñafe.  Esta zona se caracteriza porque sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura,ganadería y turismo.

La labor que M. desempeña es como personal de seguridad en el almacén de una librería desde hace algún tiempo, otra actividad que realiza es la venta de gas, la cual es una buena oportunidad de negocio ya queen su zona es elúnicoque se dedica a ese negocio.  Todas esas actividades que desempeña es con la intensión de incrementar sus ingresos para poder brindarles un mejor niveldevidaa su familia. 

M. desea comprar más gas  ya que su clientela aumentado considerablemente y para eso a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles y así seguir incrementado sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
M. is a 47 year-old father who lives in his own home together with his wife and children. His home is located in the small village of Sime, 20 minutes from Pitipo district and 40 minutes from Ferreñafe province. His home has running water and electricity. This area is noted for the fact that its residents work in agriculture, livestock raising and tourism.

M. has been working as a security guard in a book store warehouse for some time. In addition, he sells gas. The gas sales are a good business opportunity as he is the only one in his area who carries out this business. M. carries out all his business activities in order to increase his income so that he can provide his family with a better standard of living.

M. would like to buy more gas since his customer base has increased considerably. For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can continue increasing his income and thereby improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders

loans.name: Gema Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a Gema, tiene 19 años  de edad, es soltera y estudia el primer semestre en la Universidad Técnica de Manabí, ella quiere ser secretaria ejecutiva. Vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal dos  ciclos y le gusta porque con estos créditos ella puede de alguna forma ayudarse con sus estudios.

Ella y su papá tienen un negocio, venden mariscos en un puesto en el mercado de Picoaza, tienen una gran variedad de mariscos como pescado, langostinos, camarón, conchas, cangrejos, entre otras variedades. Trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 15h00, los productos compra su papá todos los días en la madrugada en la ciudad de Manta ya que allá consigue de todo para sus clientes. Ella lleva dos años en sociedad con su papá pero el ya lleva como 15 años en estas actividades.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, camarón, langostinos, conchas, cangrejos, entre otras variedades de mariscos.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y llegar a ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Mujeres de Lucha' community bank meets in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for being very commercial.  It is also noted for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas and the cheerfulness of its residents.

Here we meet 19 year-old Gema who is single and in her first semester at the Universidad Técnica de Manabí.  She would like to be an executive assistant.

Gema lives with her parents.  She has been a member of her community bank for two loan cycles and she likes it because the loans enable her to support herself in her studies.

Gema and her dad own a business selling seafood from a stall in Picoaza market.  They sell a wide variety of seafood such as fish, prawns, shrimp, shellfish, crabs, etc.  They work every day, from 6.00am to 3.00pm.  Gema's dad buys their products very early every morning in the city of Manta as he is able to acquire everything his customers need there.  Gema has been working in partnership with her dad for two years but she has been working in the business for 15 years.

Gema will use this loan to buy fish, shrimp, prawns, shellfish, crabs and other varieties of seafood.  Her dreams are to finish her studies and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, prawns, shellfish, crabs, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una madre D. familia D. 40 años, tiene casa propia y vive con su esposa e hijos, que no cuenta con ningún servicio, ubicado en la zona rural del caserio D. Cruce D. Vega, se encuentra a 15 minutos D. TambogranD. y éste a unos40 minutos d la princia D. Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza porque su gente dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Margarita se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales y aves (gallinas, pavos, cabritos y ovejas), sus corrales se encuentran en la parte posterior D. su casa.  A sus animales les proporciona alimentos  balanceados como pastos naturales y una vez que estos han llegado a su desarrollo óptimo los ofrece a la venta a los pobladores D. ese distrito como también lo comercilaiza a otras personas foraneas o llevandolos a vender los distintos mercados. Otra actividad que se dedica es al cultivo D.  limón en unas hectareas D. terreno D. cultivo que  tiene y así seguir incrementando sus ganacias. 

El préstamo solicitado por Margarita a Edpyme Alternativa es D. 2000 nuevos soles, para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales y fertilizanrtes para sus tierras D. cultivo, para que cada vez su producción sea mejor, con el único fin D. poder sacar a sus  hijos adelante dándole una mejor calidad D. vida.

Margarita como madre responsable y trabajadora quiere superarse en la vida y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Margarita is a 40 year-old mother.  She owns her own home and lives with her husband and children.  Her home doesn't have any basic services.  It is located in a rural area of the small village of Cruce D. Vega, 15 minutes from TambogranD. and 40 minutes from Piura province.  This area is noted for the fact that its residents work in agriculture, livestock raising and tourism.

Margarita raises and sells animals and birds (hens, turkeys, goats and sheep).  Her animal pens are located behind her home.  Margarita gives her animals balanced feed such as natural fodder and, once they have reached an optimum level of development, she offers them for sale to the residents of her district.  She also sells them to people from outsiD. the district or takes them to sell in different markets.  In addition, Margarita grows lemons on some hectares of farmland that she owns.  This allows her to continue increasing her profits.

Margarita has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed for her animals and fertilizers for her farmland so that she can improve her production.  Her only goal is to get her children ahead in life and proviD. them with a better quality of life.

Margarita is a responsible and hard-working mother who would like to improve herself and get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Cruz María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Cruz, tiene 69 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esta relación tuvo diez hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive una hija con sus tres nietos que son su razón de vivir.

Ella tiene un pequeño local  en las calles Chile y Alajuela en la ciudad de Portoviejo en el cual se dedica a la venta de aliños y especias, pastas de dientes, papel higiénico, entre otras muchas cosas, aquí en este sector todos los días hay una gran afluencia de personas que llegan a realizar sus compras diarias, trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las 18h00, nos cuenta que lleva en esta actividad 15 años y que de esta forma ella pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos después de la muerte de su querido esposo.

Este crédito es para comprar aliños, detergentes, pastas dentales, entre otras cosas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con estos créditos le han sacado de muchos apuros económicos.

Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes para ya no tener que salir a vender fuera de su casa.
texts.en:
The Mujeres De Lucha [Tenacious Women] Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional fiestas for San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the happiness of its people. 

Cruz is 69 years old. Her husband died several years ago, but she still has their 10 children, all of whom are grown and independent. One daughter and her family live with Cruz, and her three grandchildren are her reason for living. She has a small shop at Chile and Alajuela Streets in Portoviejo where she sells seasonings and spices, toothpaste, toilet paper, and many other things. Every day a great number of people come to the area to do their daily shopping. She works every day from 6:00am until 6:00pm. She says she has run her shop for 15 years and this was how she gave her children a good start after the death of her beloved husband. 

This loan is to purchase seasonings, detergents, toothpaste, and other items. She has been in the communal bank since it began and she likes it because these loans have gotten her out of many tight spots economically. Her dream is to have a grocery store in her house so that she can work from home.

loans.use: to purchase seasonings, detergents, tooth paste, etc. for her shop.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María José se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene  38 años  de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 9 meses de edad. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Ella es Lic. N Ciencias de La Educación. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por tres  ciclos y le gusta porque ha hecho muy buenas amistades en el grupo y por los créditos.

Es maestra de un centro educativo en la ciudad de Portoviejo, pero además de esto ella prepara y vende dulces de todos los sabores, colores y formas, trabaja todos los días, las mañanas en la escuela, las tardes y fines de semana se dedica a su negocio. Nos cuenta que muchas personas llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus productos tanto para llevarlos  a vender  a otras ciudades o para fiestas o consumo personal. Lleva siete años dedicada a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar productos e ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de sus dulces.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para facilitarle el transporte a su trabajo.
texts.en:
The María José Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional fiestas for San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the happiness of its people. 

Rosa, 38, is a single mother to a 9 month old girl. She lives with her parents, and has a degree in Educational Sciences. She has been in the Communal Bank for three cycles so far and she likes it because of the friendships she has made and the loans. 

She is a teacher in an educational center in Portoviejo, but in addition to this she makes and sells sweets of every flavor, color and shape. She works every morning at the school, and afternoons and weekends at her business. She says that many people come to her house to buy her products for themselves, as well as for parties or to sell in other cities. She has had her business for 7 years and it has gone very well for her and she has many customers. 

She will use this loan to purchase necessary supplies and ingredients for making her sweets. Her dream is to have a car to make it easier for her to get to work.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and ingredients for making sweets.

loans.name: Denny Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María José se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Denny, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y dos de 12 y 4  años los mismos que estudian en colegio y  kínder. El marido es comerciante. 

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudarle a su esposo realiza el crédito para el negocio de él, el mismo que tiene un puesto en el mercado de Portoviejo donde vende frutas y legumbres, trabaja de martes a domingos ya que los lunes se dedica a descansar del trabajo diario, el se desplaza a las 05h00 hasta el mercado mayoristas a surtirse de los mejores productos para luego llevarlos hasta su local y venderles a sus clientes, ella nos cuentas que su marido lleva cerca de 20 años en este tipo de negocio.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar frutas de todo tipo, legumbres y verduras.  Lleva en el Banco Comunal siete años  y le gusta porque  con estos créditos ella por lo menos puede ayudar a su esposo en su dura tarea.
 
Su sueño es terminar su casa que la tiene en construcción.
texts.en:
The communal ank Maria Jose meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its commercial activity, the San Pedro and San Pablo festivities and joyfulness of its people.

Here we meet Mrs. Derry, age 40, who is married and has four children.  Two of them are adults and the other two are 12 and 4 years old and in school and kindergarten.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a good homemaker and also handles the credit activity related to her husband's business in the Portoviejo market where he sells fruit and legumes.  He works Tuesday through Sunday since Monday is when he takes the day off.  He goes to the wholesale market at 5:00 a.m. to select the best products to sell to his customers.  He has been in business for 20 years.

This loan will be used to buy all kinds of fruit, legumes and vegetables.  Derry has been in the communal bank for seven years and enjoys being able to use the loans to help her husband with his hard work.  Her dream is to finish her house which is currently in construction.

loans.use: To buy legumes, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Magaly Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María José se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Magaly, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 16 y 8 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por tres  ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos ha ido mejorando dia a dia su vida.

Realiza este crédito para construir una pequeña cisterna en su casa parar que nunca les falte el agua, este liquido vital tan importante y que no hay por este sector, nos cuenta que en esta parte de la ciudad el agua no llega a través de tuberías sino que tiene que comprala y almacenar en pequeños tanques y al comprar así el agua no les dura mucho y le sale muy caro, por eso quiere construir su cisterna para comprar por tanqueros completos y así poder tener agua suficiente y a mejor precio para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar cemento, hierro, ripio, arena y otros materiales necesarios para poder llevar a cabo esta obra.
   
Sus sueños son tener buena salud y arreglar su casa lo mejor posible.
texts.en:
The María José communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo’s Picoaza Parish, a place renown for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional feasts of Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the joy of its residents.

We met Magaly, 40, here.  She’s married and has two children who are 16 and 8 years of age; both go to school.  Her husband is a merchant.   She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and she likes it because the loans have been improving her life day to day.

She is taking out this loan to build a small cistern in her house so that they’ll never lack water, this so vital liquid that is not available in this sector.  She tells us that in this part of the city water does not arrive through pipes but rather it must be purchased and stored in small tanks.  Having to buy water this way is expensive and the water doesn’t last very long.  Because of this she wants to build a cistern so that she can buy water by the tank truck full and thus have sufficient water at a better price to improve her quality of life.

She will use this loan to buy cement, iron rods, gravel, sand and other materials needed to carry out this project.  Her dreams are to be healthy and to fix up her house the best way possible.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel es un hombre soltero de 40 años de edad,  tiene casa propia, vive solo, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo  luz. Su casa está ubicada en la  Pradera que pertenece a la provincia  de Chiclayo.  Es una zona urbana dedicada exclusivamente al comercio, agricultura y turismo.

Samuel se dedica ha manejar su mototaxi (transporte utilizado por las personas en rutas pequeñas que tiene como cupo máximo de 3 personas), ésta labor lo realiza diariamente  en la ciudad de Chiclayo, cuenta con  su propia clientela y también se dedica a criar animales como cabritos y carneros, su corral se encuentra en la parte exterior de su casa, ésto le permite obtener mayores ingresos para poder cubrir sus necesidades diarias.

A solicitado Samuel un préstamo ha Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para brindarle mantenimiento a su mototaxi y para comprar más animales para su venta en los distintos mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo, permitiéndole cubrir así su préstamo como tener un mejor nivel de vida.

Samuel es muy cocnocido por ser una persona  de confianza, muy respetuoso y responsable con su clientes que utilizan sus transporte, con el único objetivo de salir adelante y poderles ayudar enviando a sus padres un poco de dinero ya que se encuentran en otro lugar.
texts.en:
Samuel is a single, 40-year-old man.  He has a house of his own and lives alone.  The house only has electricity and is located in La Pradera which is part of Chiclayo Province.  It’s an urban zone dedicated exclusively to commerce, farming and tourism.

Samuel drives a mototaxi (transport used by people on short routes; it can carry a maximum of three people).  He works daily in the city of Chiclayo and has his own clientele.  He also raises animals, like goats and calves; his corral is located in his yard.  This makes it possible for him to earn higher income to cover his daily needs.

Samuel has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan to service his mototaxi and to buy more animals to sell in Chiclayo’s various markets which will allow him to repay his loan and have a better standard of living.

Samuel is very well known for being a trustworthy, very respectful and responsible person with the customers who use his means of transport.  His only goal is to get ahead and be able to help out his parents sending them a little money because they are located elsewhere.

loans.use: to buy more animals and to service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian es un padre de familia de 52 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, que cuenta sólo con agua potable en el sector La Calera, la cual se encuentra a unos 10 minutos del distrito de Reque y ha 10 minutos más de la ciudad de chiclayo.   Es un  distrito que se caracteriza por que sus pobladores se dedican a la  actividad agricola, ganadera y turismo.

Julian se dedica hace más de 15 años a las labores agricolas junto con sus hijos quienes le ayudan para que el trabajo sea menos pesado, en sus chacaras o tierras cultiva frijol Bayo (especie de frijol) que es un alimento sano y rico para el consumo diario de los pobladores. Una vez que cosecha sus ingresos aumentarán y podrá seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.

Julian  a solicitado un préstamo  de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de semilla de frijol  para sembrar en otra área de cultivo que tiene,con la finalidad de tener más productos que vender enlos distintos mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  Todas esas mejoras que tiene Julian es solo para tener mejores ingresos económicos y poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Julián, 52, is a father living with his wife and children in a house of his own, that only has potable water, in La Calera which is located about 10 minutes from Reque District and 10 minutes more from the city of Chiclayo.  It’s a district that’s characterized by its residents who are involved in farming, raising livestock and tourism.

Julián has been farming his fields for over 15 years; his children help him with the less heavy chores.  He farms Frijol Bayo (a species of bean) that is a healthy, rich food used daily by the residents.  Once it’s harvested his income will increase and he will continue improving his quality of life.

Julián is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy bean seeds to plant in another area he has with the end in mind of having more products to sell in Chiclayo’s various markets.  All these improvements that Julian has are aimed at producing more income to cover family needs.

loans.use: to buy more brown bean seeds.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en una casa propia, la cual cuenta con el servicio solo de luz por ser una zona rural, ubicada en el Cojal que pertenece al distrito de Cayaltí  y se encuentra a unos 30 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo. Las actividades que se desarrollan es ésta zona es la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

José se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y aves de corral, desde hace 10 años aproximadamente, sus corrales se encuentran a unos minutos de su vivienda. A sus animales los  alimenta con dieta  balanceada y pastos naturales  y una vez que llegaron a su desarrollo ideal los vende en los distintos mercados de la ciudad de chiclayo, una vez que los vende podrá cubrir todas sus necesidades.

A solicitado un crédito José a Edpyme Alternativa de 600 nuevos soles para continuar comprando aves de corral para luego venderlas con la finalidad detener mejores ingresos para poder pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

José es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive por sus ansias de superarse cada día y darles una  mejor oportunidad a su hijo en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old and lives with his wife and son in their own home.  They live in a rural area so they only have electricity.   They live in Cojal in the district of Cayaltí, 30 minutes from the province of Chiclayo.  The residents of this area work in agriculture, tourism and they raise livestock.  

José has been raising cattle and poultry for approximately 10 years.  His pens are located just a few minutes from his house.  He feeds his animals a balanced diet and natural grasses.  Once they reach their ideal size he sells them in the various markets in the city of Chiclayo.  Once he sells them he will be able to cover all his necessities.  

José is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 600 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] so that he can continue buying poultry to sell with the end result of having a better income to repay his loan and improve his family's quality of life.  

José is very well-known in his area for his desire to excel every day and to give his son a better chance in the near future.    .

loans.use: to purchase more poultry.

loans.name: Claudia  Janeth

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia es una persona muy  emprendedora , requiere el préstamo porque desea comprar  mercancía  para su  negocio  ya  que  actualmente  se  dedica  a la  venta de  ropa  usada,  su mayor  preocupación es brindarles  un  excelente servicio  a  sus clientes, agradece  el  apoyo   brindado para   realizar  su  proyecto  ya  que   ve  en el  crédito la  posibilidad  de  ofrecerles a  sus  pequeños  hijos una  excelente  estabilidad  económica.
texts.en: Mrs. Claudia is a hardworking person. She is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise for her business. She sells used clothes. Her greatest concern is providing her customers with good service. She appreciates her customer’s support of her business. With this loan she has the opportunity to offer her small children stable economic support.

loans.use: to buy used clothes that she sells.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
María  tiene 19 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo.  Reside junto a su esposo en la ciudad Ferreñafe, zona  bastante comercial que pertenece al departamento de  Lambayeque, se encuentra situada un zona rural a de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a trabajar vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar más clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar a su  esposo  en el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar.
Es su deseo  de María poder mejorar su casa, y ampliar su negocio para que pueda brindarle a su familia comodidad,  seguridad y una mejor calidad de vida.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
Maria es una madre bastante entregada a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Maria is 19 years old, married and has one child. She lives with her husband in the city of Ferreñafe, a commercial zone that belongs to the Lambayeque Department, which is in a rural zone about a half hour away from Chiclayo City.
She sells cosmetics through a catalogue. She sells these prodeucts to her neighbors and friends. Each day she works to increase her client base as with more orders she makes more money. This business helps her with personal expenses and helps her husband with the economic maintenance of their house. 
Maria wishes to improve her house and grow her business so that her family will be comfortable, secure and have a better quality of life. With this in mind, she is requesting a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Maria is always concerned for the health and development of her family. The people that know her think of her with much esteem and affection.

loans.use: to improve her house and grow her business.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: El Sr. Rogelio utilizara su crédito para la construcción de un cuarto ya que comenta que  pronto  recibirán la llegada  de su  hijo,  por lo cual ve la necesidad de construir otra  habitación  para  que  el pequeño  pueda tener   su propio espacio, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  ya  que  ve en el crédito la oportunidad de realizar su proyecto.
texts.en: Mr. Rogelio will use this loan to build a room as his son is coming to live with him. He needs to build a bedroom in order for the youngster to have his own space. He is thankful for the support of this loan that will give him the opportunity to complete this project.

loans.use: to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
María tiene 24  años de edad, ella es casada.  Vive en casa propia, con sus dos menores hijos dependientes. María reside  en un anexo llamado  San Antonio de Padua, ubicado a 07 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque. 
Se dedica se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral, el cría gallinas, patos, pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente trabaja como agricultora.
María desea adquirir más animales y sus respectivos  alimentos ya que la demanda  de sus animales esta en aumento es, por ello que ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.
María es una madre bastante entregada a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Maria is 24 years old and is married.  She lives in her own home with her two dependent children.  María lives in an annex called San Antonio de Padua, 7 minutes from the city of Lambayeque.  She raises small animals and poultry such as hens, ducks and turkeys in the back part of her house.  When they reach a good size she sells them to the merchants that usually visit the area where she lives.  She also works as a farmer.  She wants to buy more animals and feed as the demand for her animals is increasing.  For this reason she is requesting a loan of 800 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa .

Maria is very committed to her family and is always looking after their well-being and development.  Those that know her are very fond of her and hold her in high esteem.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry and feed.

location.town: San Antonio - Muy Finca - Mochumí - Lambayeque

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cheese and chorizo sausage

loans.name: Rita Liliana

texts.es:
Rita Liliana es una joven muy activa que sueña con estudiar veterinaria para agregar nuevos servicios a su negocio ubicado en el barrio La Paya, donde se dedica a la comercialización de productos veterinarios y naturales  en un local de propiedad de su madre cercano a su vivienda, en la actualidad en proceso constructivo.
Su idea emprendedora nació en el año 2008 cuando al morir su esposo, su madre la inspiró e impulsó a que aprovechara un local de su propiedad y la ayudó a iniciar con la venta de productos veterinarios, además de que  Rita con su perro, aprendió empíricamente a tratar a los animales y esto la ayudó mucho.
Ella concentrada en su unidad de negocio logró paulatinamente crecer, comprando poco a poco una vitrina e inventario, pero quiere crecer aún mas, por eso está solicitando su credikiva, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de medicamentos veterinarios, accesorios para animales  y en la adición de nuevas marcas de productos naturales. Este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con su anterior crédito logró estabilizar su negocio y un gradual crecimiento de sus inventarios, porque ahora cuenta con un capital propio. Su sueño es estudiar veterinaria para adicionarle a su negocio una gama de servicios, como la farmacia naturista que es su gran desafio.
texts.en:
Rita Liliana is an active young lady who dreams about studying to be a veterinarian to add new services to her business in the neighborhood of La Paya.  This is where she sells veterinarian and natural products in a shop owned by her mother and which is close to her house, currently under construction.

Her enterprising idea started in 2008 when her husband passed away.  Her mother inspired her to take advantage of the shop and helped her to start selling veterinarian products.  With her dog, Rita learned all about taking care of pets and this has helped her tremendously.

By concentrating on her business she was able to grow little by little, buying a display case and inventory.  But she wants to expand even further and has requested a CrediKiva loan to buy veterinarian medicines, pet accessories and new brands of natural products.  This is her second loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She used her first loan to stabilize her business and gradually increase inventory.  Now she has her own capital.  Her dream is to study veterinary medicine to add it to her services.  Natural pharmaceuticals are her great challenge.

loans.use: To buy veterinarian medicines, pet accessories and new brands of natural products

loans.name: Erlita

texts.es:
Erlita tiene 40 años de edad, ella es casada.  Vive con su esposo y s menor hijo en una  parte urbana del distrito de Jose Leonardo Ortiz a pocos minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo este distrito, contando con todos sus servicios básicos (agua y energía eléctrica).

Erlita se dedica a la venta de cerveza y carbón desde hace más de 6 años. Y poco a poca ella ha ido comprando su mercadería, la creciente demanda del negocio de Erlita la ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles.

Cliente ha ido creciendo económicamente dado que su nivel de vida se ha ido acomodando con el pasar de los años.

Erlita  a trabajado con nosotros anteriormente los ha cancelado con bastante puntualidad. Es primera vez que se le otorga crédito en modalidad de capital semilla dado que es un cliente muy puntual.
Erlita es muy conocida por ser una persona de confianza, muy respetuosa y responsable con sus clientes su  único objetivo de salir adelante y poder contribuir en su hogar.
texts.en:
Erlita is 40 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and small son in the urban part of the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, just a few minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  This district has all the basic utilities (running water and electricity).

Erlita has been selling beer and coal for six years.  Little by little she has purchased merchandise but now the growing demand in her business has caused her to think about expanding and acquiring more products.  She decided to request a loan in the amount of 3,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

Over the years she has been able to grow economically and her lifestyle has improved.

Erlita has taken out previous loans and paid them back on time.  This is the first time she has received a loan as seed capital since she is a well-paying customer.

Erlita is well-known for her dependability.  She is respectful and responsible with her customers.  Her only goal is to get ahead and be able to contribute to her household.

loans.use: To buy more products (beer and coal) for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a stove

loans.name: Rosario Noemi

texts.es:
Rosario Noemí tiene 28 años de edad, ella es casad y tiene dos hijos. Vive en saltar en cuidad de Zaña en casa propia  a 45 minutos de cuidad de Chiclayo 

Rosario Noemí  cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y bebidas. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida.  Con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Rosario Noemí a solicitado un préstamo Edpyme alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles, debido a la  creciente demanda que la bodega ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla, con este préstamo ella podrá comprar mas productos y de esta manera habrá un incremento  sus ingresos familiares. 
Rosario Noemí  es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Rosario Noemí is 28 years old, she is married and has two children. She lives in the city of Zaña in her own home which is about 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

Rosario Noemí has a small grocery store located in her home which she attends to herself. She offers everyday consumer products including staples, groceries and drinks to her neighbors and clients in the area. The business has been well received. With this business she helps her husband with the economic support of her family. 

Rosario Noemí has requested a loan from field partner Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles (PEN) because of the growing demand she has been experiencing in her store. This has led her to think about expanding her store. With this loan she will be able to buy more products and this will result in a increase in her family's income. 

Rosario Noemí is a hardworking woman of good character. The people that know her have much esteem and affection for her.

loans.use: purchase supplies for her store.

loans.name: Lucy
