texts.es: Lucy estela B., vive en el barrio Villa del Carmen en el municipio de Soledad  con su esposo(quien aparece en la fotografia) y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 6 a 10 años;  desde allí se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada como cosméticos , ropa etc. Ella también tiene otro negocio de vender  carne de cerdo y gallina por libras que le genera ingresos importantes; estas ideas emprendedores nacieron de la imaginación de Lucy, para apoyar la gestión de su esposo en el hogar,  pues hasta antes de ella ser trabajadora independiente la asumía él solo;  así fue como empezó con poco capital ofreciendo crédito y tiene que esperar recoger sus cartera para poder responderle a su clientela, este es la razón por la cual acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para solicitar un credikiva, que es el primer financiamiento que recibe de esta organización, con la cual desea crecer de su mano; Con este dinero comprará, talcos, desodorantes, productos de tocador, carne de cerdo, gallina, para venderla en esta época de Mayo, mes  en el cual repuntan sus ventas por qué ocurre la celebración del día des madres, que convoca a la unidad y donde las familias compran a Lucy sus mercancías para obsequiarlas a las madres de sus familias y también compran carne  de cerdo y gallina para preparar y compartir comidas especiales  para celebrar este maravillosos día.
texts.en: Lucy Estela B. lives in the Villa del Carmen neighborhood, in the town of Soledad, with her husband (who appears in the photo) and their three children, who are between the ages of 6 and 10. She earns a living by selling a variety of merchandise, including cosmetics and clothing. She also has another business selling pork and chicken by the pound, which brings in a good amount of money. Lucy is creative and entrepreneurial and started these businesses to help her husband support the family, which he used to do by himself before she became an independent worker. She started out with just a little money and offers her goods on credit, so she's turning to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to ask for a Kiva loan. This is the first financing she's received from this organization, and is hoping to use it to expand her business. She will purchase talcum powder, deodorant, beauty products, pork, and chicken, and sell them this month. Her sales are always up in May because of Mother's Day, as families come together and buy Lucy's products as gifts for their mothers and buy meat in order to celebrate special meals on this wonderful day.

loans.use: to buy pork and chicken, as well as merchandise such as talcum powder, deodorant, and beauty products.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Esther es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad y vive con su esposo y sus tres hijas en el distrito de Paiján – La Libertad, en la zona rural de este.

Esther  es conocida, por sus vecinos, por ser una persona trabajadora y responsable. Ella se dedica  a la venta de abarrotes al por menor (arroz, azúcar, leche aceite), gaseosas y golosinas en una pequeña bodega instalada en su casa. El dinero que Esther gana sirve para complementar los ingresos que su esposo produce trabajando como obrero y agricultor, ya que este trabajo se da de manera eventual.

Esther solicita un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para invertir en su negocio, específicamente en la compra de abarrotes, gaseosas, golosinas y otros productos.

Esther quiere sacar adelante a su familia y tiene muchos deseos de superación. En primera instancia quiere hacer que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Esther, 43 years old, lives with her husband and three children in the rural eastern area of the district of Paiján – La Libertad.

Esther's neighbors know her as a hard-working, responsible person. She sells groceries (rice, sugar, milk, oil), soft drinks, and sweets in a small shop she set up in her house. The money Esther earns supplements her husband's income as a farm worker, which is more sporadic.

Esther is requesting a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in her business; she will use the money to buy groceries, soft drinks, candies, and other products.

Esther wants to help her family get ahead and dreams of having a better life. Her most immediate wish is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries, soft drinks, and sweets for her business.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
María Elsa tiene 31 años D. edad.  Vive en una zona D. Jayanca   donD. solo cuentan con  servicios básicos (agua y energía eléctrica). Jayanca es un poblado  pequeño D. aproximadamente  100 familias, esta ubicado a50 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

María Elsa cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma. Allí ofrece en venta a los vecinos y clientes D. la zona diversos productos D. consumo diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad, abarrotes y bebidas. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida.  Con estas actividades ella solventa sus gastos diarios.
 
Además desD. hace 3 años se dedica también a la cría animales menores, especialmente aves, en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. El los alimenta D. granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donD. resiD..

María Elsa desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Elsa es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar la su calidad.
texts.en:
María Elsa is 31 years old. She lives in an area of Jayanca that only has basic services like running water and electricity. Jayanca is a small village of about 100 families, located about 50 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.
María Elsa has a small shop set up in her house, which she runs herself. In it she offers her neighbors and other area customers a wiD. range of products, including household essentials, groceries, and beverages. The business does very well and she is able to cover her daily expenses.
In addition, for the past three years she has been raising small animals, especially barnyard fowl, in some enclosures near her home. She feeds them grains and grasses, and when they're big enough she sells them to dealers who often pass through the area where she lives.
María Elsa would like to acquire more animals and balanced feed in order to expand her business and increase her income, so she's requesting a loan of 800 soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will help her reach her goals.
Elsa is a hard-working person and her greatest wish is to keep growing as a businesswoman to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more barnyard fowl and feed for them.

loans.name: Basilides

texts.es:
Basilides tiene 68 años de edad es un señor casado que vive  en la zona rural de  la campiña San Nicolás -Lambayeque. Zona cuya actividad principal es la agricultura y ganadería.

Basilides a pesar de sus años, tiene que ver la manera de mantener su hogar y es por eso que desde hace un año vende verduras en el mercado de Lambayeque, donde es conocido por la buena calidad de sus productos y por ello goza de una clientela ya establecida. Basilides adicionalmente cría y comercializa aves de corral (pato, pavo) y  también realiza actividades agrícolas, como la cosecha de limones.

Basilides solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles, cuyo destino será la compra de mercadería (verduras) y otros gastos personales que necesita realizar.
texts.en:
Basilides is 68 years old.  He is a married man that lives in the rural area of San Nicolás - Lambayeque where the primary business is agriculture and raising livestock.  

In spite of his age, Basilides has to provide for his household.  Because of this he has been selling vegetables in the Lambayeque market for a year.  He enjoys a well established customer base because he is known for his high quality products.  He also raises and sells poultry (ducks, turkeys) and works in agriculture, such as harvesting lemons.  

Basilides is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency].  He will use it to purchase merchandise (vegetables) and to cover other personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell and personal expenses.

loans.name: Juan Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. Juan es un padre de familia muy responsable,  comenta  que acudió con nosotros para solicitar su crédito ya que le quiere hacer unos arreglos a su casa, anteriormente   realizo una pequeña  barra en el interior de  su  domicilio y una cocina, las cuales por  falta  de  recursos no  a  podido  concluir ya que no le alcanzo con el presupuesto que  tenia  contemplado, el  Sr. Juan  ve  en el  crédito  la  posibilidad  de   ofrecer  una  mayor  comodidad  a  su  familia la cual  representa  lo mas  valioso  en su  vida.
texts.en: Mr. Juan is the father of a responsible family.  He says that he came to us for credit because he wants to make some repairs in his home. Previously he built a small bar inside his home and kitchen, which for lack of resources he could not complete because it did not stay within the budget that he had thought it would.  With this loan, Juan sees the possibility to offer comfort to his family which is the most valuable thing in his life.

loans.use: To refurbish his kitchen.

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es:
José es un cliente de 56  años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Túcume- Lambayeque.  El distrito de Túcume es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100 familias y es un distrito conocido por ser un destino turístico Lambayecano, donde los artesanos del pueblo deleitan  alos extranjeros con sus productos. Además de esto , Túcume se le conoce por ser una comunidad agrícola y ganadera.

José se dedica a la venta de animales desde hace 20 años, lo que le da una ineludible experiencia en este rubro. José se dedica, actualmente, a la venta de ganado porcino y ovino a compradores e la zona. 

José solicita un  crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles los cuales invertirá en compra de animales y alimento balanceado para estos.Para ques estos sean más y de mejor calidad y José pueda obtener mayores ingresos gracias a sus ventas.

Este es el tercer préstamo solicitado por José a Edpyme aLternativa. Es un cliente responsable  y puntual.
texts.en:
José is 56 years old.  He lives with his wife in their own home, located in the Túcume- Lambayeque district.  The Túcume district is a small community of approximately 100 families.  Lambayeque is an area known for being a tourist spot where village artisans delight visitors with their products.  In addition to this Túcume is known for being a farming community.  

José has sold animals for 20 years, which gives him an inescapable experience in this field.  José is currently focusing on selling pigs and sheep to buyers in the area.

José is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1500 soles which he will invest in buying animals and balanced feed for them.  This way he will have more animals of better quality.  José will be be able to receive a better income thanks to his sales.  

This is the third loan José has requested from Edpyme Alternativa. He is a responsible and punctual client.

loans.use: To buy animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Elbis Roel

texts.es:
Elbis es un señor de 30 años de edad que tiene una familia a cargo, una esposa y una hija. Ellos viven en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz- Chiclayo. Este distrito es uno de los tantos distritos de Chiclayo que comenzó siendo una zona urbano –marginal (de condición muy pobre) y se fue desarrollando poco a poco gracias al esfuerzo de sus habitantes. Esta comunidad, es una comunidad de grandes comerciantes.

Elbis, tiene 6 años de experiencia en el ámbito de construcción civil. 

Elbis es un cliente antiguo de Edpyme Alternativa y solicita  un préstamo de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar materiales de construcción, para realizar una obra que le han dejado a cargo. Con la remuneración de esta obra el podrá cancelar el préstamo y usar otra parte del dinero para los gastos del hogar.

Elbis cuenta con buena reputación en la empresa, por haber cancelado puntualmente más de 5 créditos.
texts.en:
Elbis is 30 years old and has a dependent family, a wife and daughter. They live in the José Leonardo Ortiz- Chiclayo district.  This district is one of the many of Chiclayo that started becoming marginally urban (of poor condition) and was developed little by little thanks to the force of the residents. This community is a large community of traders.

Elbis has 6 years of experience in civil construction. 

Elbis is an old client of Edpyme Alternativa and is requesting a loan of 2500 soles to buy building materials to complete a job that remains in progress. With the compensation from this job he will be able to cancel the loan and use part of the money for home expenses. 

Elbis has a good reputation in the company, having paid on time more than 5 loans.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Maria Janet

texts.es:
María tiene 34 años de edad y vive con su esposo y sus tres niños en el caserío El Porvenir Hualtaco III, en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. El hogar de María no cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y desagüe.

El esposo de María se dedica a labores de agricultura, cosechando limón y también  tiene un trabajo fijo realizando labores de campo en un fundo cercano a su zona.  

María se dedica a la venta de ropa la cual realiza en su propio domicilio y recorriendo los diferentes caseríos cercanos a su zona, donde ya la conocen por sus buenos productos y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida.

María ha solicitado un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles, a Edpyme Alternativa para comprar mercadería (prendas de vestir y zapatos) y ampliar el local que tiene en su domicilio y así poder seguir creciendo en su actividad.

El hogar de María es un hogar con muchos deseos de superación, ya que maría y su esposo desean darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María, 34, lives with her husband and three children in the El Porvenir Hualtaco III hamlet in Tambogrande-Piura District.  María’s home does not have the basic utilities of water and sewage.  María’s husband is a lemon farmer and is also employed as a field hand on a nearby large farm.

María sells clothes from home and also by going to the various settlements in her area where she is already known for the good products she has; she has a well established regular clientele.

María has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan to buy merchandise (articles of clothing and shoes) and to expand the locale she has at home to continue growing in her business.

María’s home is a home with much desire for self improvement because María and her husband want to provide a better life for their children.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing for her business.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis es un hombre soltero de 21 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres que cuenta con todos los servicios (agua, luz y desagüe),es una zopna urbana ubicada en la provinciade Chiclayo.  Ciudad que se caracteriza porque su actividad principal es el  comercio al por mayor y menor y el turismo.
Jose Luis se dedica a la venta de carne de aves (pollo, gallina, patos, etc.), desde hace 2 años, la venta lo realiza en el mercado Modelo de Chiclayo,tiene un negocio muy próspero, en el cual cada día va incrementando más sus ganancias, lo que le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
A solicitado José Luis un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de un refrigerador para guardar sus productos y no se deterioren, lo cual le permitirá atender mayor cantidad de clientes y así podra aumentar sus ventas, para seguir ayudando a sus padres en los gastos de casa.
José Luis es un jovén responsable y trabajador conocido en el mercado por ser una persona alegre y con ganas de seguir superarndose en la vida constantemente.
texts.en:
José Luis, 21, is single and lives in his parents’ house that has all basic utilities (water, electricity and sewage) in an urban area located in Chiclayo Province.  This city is notable because its main activity is wholesale and retail commerce and tourism.

José Luis has sold different meats from fowl (duck, chicken, turkey, etc) for the last two years.  His sales take place in Chiclayo’s Modelo Market.  He has a very prosperous business where profits have been increasing daily which makes it possible for him to have a better quality of life.

José Luis has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy a refrigerator to store his products so that they won’t spoil.  This will make it possible for him to tend to a larger number of customers and thus increase sales to continue helping his parents with household expenses.

José Luis is a responsible, hard working young man who is known in the market for being a cheerful person with a strong desire to continue to constantly improve in life.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to store his products.

loans.name: Maria Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene tiene 24 años D. edad, es madre D. dos niños con los que vive junto a su esposo en el distrito D. TambogranD.- Piura,  en la parte rural D. este distrito y no cuentan con los servicios básicos.

Su esposo es agricultor y trabaja en un fundo agrícola. Esta actividad la realiza desD. hace más D. 4 años. 

Marlene es conocida por ser una persona honrada, bondadosa y sobre todo trabajadora. La actividad que desarrolla es la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad (arroz, agua, azúcar,huevos) en la sala D. su domicilio y  la venta D. ropa recorriendo caseríos cercanos a su zona. Además, Marlene, crías ovejas y aves D. corral, como patos y pavos.

Marlene solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles los cuales usará para la compra D. mercadería para su pequeña bodega (productos D. primera necesidad) y prendas D. vestir para entregar a clientes por pedidos realizados. Otra parte del préstamo será destinada a la compra D.  alimentos para sus ovinos.

Marlene quiere invertir en sus tres negocios para seguir creciendo económicamente y mejorar su calida D. vida.
texts.en:
Marlene, 24, is the mother of two children.  She lives with them and her husband in the rural part of TambogranD.-Piura District.  They do not have basic utilities.  Her husband’s a farmer and also employed at a large farm.  He’s been in this line of work for over four years.

Marlene is known for being an honest, kind and, above all, hard working person.  She sells basic need items (rice, water, sugar, eggs) in her living room and also sells clothes going from nearby settlement to nearby settlement in her area.  In addition, Marlene raises sheep and barnyard fowl like ducks and turkeys.

Marlene has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan that she’ll use to buy merchandise for her small store (basic need items) and articles of clothing to fill pending customer orders.  Another part of the loan will be used to buy feed for her sheep.

Marlene wants to invest in her three businesses to continue growing economically and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store and to buy clothes.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan  es un joven que se dedica a al elaboración de balones anteriormente él trabajaba para su tía en la fabrica de balones pero ahora es independiente y hace sus propios balones, el cliente es bastante trabajador y conoce bastante de su área, gracias a su trabajo el puede ayudar a su familia que vive en La Paz, el actualmente tiene bastante mercado y también viaja a provincias para comerciar sus productos, comenta que a un mediano plazo piensa retornar a su tierra natal La Paz para estar al lado de sus padres y sus hermanos.  Él vive en alquiler en un cuarto en la casa de su tía, con el dinero del crédito comprar balones por cantidad para poder comercializar, es una persona muy trabajadora y se encuentra agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man who manufactures balls.  He used to work for his aunt in the ball factory but now he’s independent and he makes his own balls.  He is quite hard working and knowledgeable in his area.  Thanks to his work he’s able to help out his family that lives in La Paz.  He currently has quite a few customers and also travels to the provinces to sell his products.  He comments that in the medium run he plans to return to his native city, La Paz, to be with his parents and siblings.

He lives in a room he rents from his aunt.  He will use the loan to buy balls in quantity to sell.  He is a very hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy footballs and fulbito (typical Peruvian variation of football) balls.

loans.name: Liset Fabiola

texts.es:
Liset  es madre soltera de una niña, tiene 23 años de edad. Ellas viven en el Caserío Palominos ubicado en el distrito Tambogrande – Piura. Clienta vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Liset es una mujer dedicada a su hija y es por eso que es conocida en su distrito por ser una mujer muy trabajadora. La actividad que desarrolla Liset es la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, hace 2 campañas por mes y tiene una experiencia de 8 meses en este negocio.

Liset solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 600 nuevos soles que le servirán para la compra de mercadería (perfumes, maquillaje) en oferta. Esto le permitirá a Liset incrementar la cantidad de productos que tiene y así conseguir mayores ventas. El dinero ganado con estas ventas lo invertirá en su menor hija, en su alimentación y vestido.

Liset cuenta con buenas referencias personales y con un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Liset, 23, is a single mother of a daughter.  They live in the hamlet of Palominos located in the rural part of Tambogrande-Piura District; she does not have basic utilities.

Liset is a mother devoted to her daughter and this is why she’s known in her district for being a very hard working woman.  Liset sells beauty products via catalogue.  She does two sales campaigns per month and has 8 months experience in the business.

Liset has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 600 new sol loan to buy merchandise (perfume, make-up) that’s on sale.  This will make it possible for Liset to increase the amount of products she has available thus gaining higher sales.  Money from the sales will be invested in her daughter’s clothing and food.

Liset has good personal references and good credit history.

loans.use: to buy perfume and make-up.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies and to repair machinery.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana es una madre separada de 28 años de edad. El hijo de Viviana tiene 9 años.  Desde el nacimiento de su pequeño hijo, ellos viven en casa de la madre de Viviana en la zona urbano-marginal (condición pobre) del distrito de La Victoria- Chiclayo.

El distrito de La Victoria, es una comunidad de comerciantes y Viviana es uno de ellos. Viviana se dedica, desde hace 5 años a la venta de ropa, zapatos y artículos de vestir. Viviana no sólo vende su mercadería en  La Victoria, sino que sus ventas se han extendido a lo largo de la ciudad de Chiclayo, esto se debe a la buena calidad de sus productos y a la venta a crédito que ella realiza. Viviana  también tiene ingresos adicionales por la venta de tamales (alimento tradicional peruano, hecho a base de maíz molido seco) que realiza junto a su madre.

Viviana ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1800 nuevos soles, que invertirá en la compra de productos de temporada para su negocio, estos productos han sido solicitados por sus clientes. Con la ganancia obtenida de estas ventas, Viviana podrá pagar la educación de su menor hijo.
texts.en:
Viviana is a mother, separated, and 28 years old. Viviana’s son is 9 years old. Since the birth of her little son, they have lived in Viviana’s mother’s house in the peri-urban area (poor) of the district of La Victoria-Chiclayo.

The district of La Victoria is a merchant community and Viviana is one of those.  For the last 5 years, Viviana has been selling clothes, shoes and other items to wear. Viviana not only sells her merchandise in La Victoria, but has also extended her sales throughout the city of Chiclayo.  This is due to the good quality of her products and that she sells on credit. Viviana gets additional income from selling tamales (traditional Peruvian food made from dried milled corn), which she does with her mother. 

Viviana has requested a loan of 1800 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which she will invest in the purchase of seasonal products for her business. These products have been requested by her customers.  With the profit from these sales, Viviana will be able to pay for her young son’s education.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her business.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
José  tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y reside en el caserío La Raya, tiene como actividad principal a la agricultura y que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Tucume  30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace muchos años, el suele sembrar e arroz en su terreno de cultivo con el que cuenta, cuando realiza su cosecha, este producto final lo vende en centros molineros de la region.

José  desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de arroz, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

José es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresario y salir adelante.
texts.en:
José, 36, is married living in the La Raya hamlet where the main activity is farming.  It’s located in Túcume District, 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been working in farming associated activities for many years.  He tends to plant rice in his fields.  When it’s harvested the final product is sold to regional mills.

José wants to buy fertilizer for his rice crops.  He hopes this action will lead to a good harvest.  Because of this he’s had the need to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

José is quite a calm, responsible person.  His greatest wish is to grow as a businessman and to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Nelly Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nelly Elizabeth tiene 30 años de edad, tiene dos hijos menores. Vive en en la provincia de Chepen 

Nelly Elizabeth se dedica a trabajar vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar más clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. A si mismo se dedica a la venta de calzado por pedido.
El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos familiares y le ayuda  en el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar.
Nelly Elizabeth  desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos , de esta manera tener algunos en su almacén para su distribución. Por ello a creido por conveniente solicitar un prestamo a Edpyme Alternativa 1000 nuevos soles para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos.
Nelly Elizabeth es una cliente antigua para Edpyme Alternativa, y solo trabaja con esta institución. Nelly Elizabeth  en todo momento, ha demostrado su responsabilidad y puntualidad.
texts.en:
Nelly Elizabeth is 30 years old.  She has two minor children.  She lives in Chepén Province.

Nelly Elizabeth works selling cosmetics via catalogue.  She sells these products among her neighbors and acquaintances.  She strives daily to obtain more customers because the more orders she places the higher the income she earns from the company supplying her products.  She also sells shoes on order. The business helps her meet family expenses and helps her support her household economy.

Nelly Elizabeth wants to expand the business acquiring more products so that she can have some of them on hand in her store to sell.  To do so, she’s felt it advisable to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach her goal.

Nelly Elizabeth is a long standing Edpyme Alternativa client and only works with this institution.  Nelly Elizabeth has shown responsibility and punctuality all the time.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to stock her business.

loans.name: Constancio Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Constancio tiene 36 años de edad, es divorciado, vive con su hijita de 6 años en la zona de el Palmar,  Hace 12 años que se vino de Cochabamba buscando mejores días y se compro su micro; desde entonces trabaja en el rubro de transporte, el crédito que se le otorgo es para mantenimiento de su micro (compra de repuestos nuevos, compra de llantas. etc.). El cliente quedo agradecido por la confianza que deposito en el la institución y por la rapidez del crédito, es una persona joven que desea darle un futuro mejor a su hijita.
texts.en:
Constancio, 36, is divorced.  He lives with his 6-year-old daughter in El Palmar.  He came to Cochabamba 12 years ago seeking better days and bought a microbus.  Since then he’s been working in transportation.

The loan he was granted was to service his microbus (to buy new replacement parts, tires, etc.)  He was grateful for the trust that the institution placed in him and for the speed with which the loan was granted.  He is a young person who wants to give his daughter a better future.

loans.use: to service his microbus and buy replacement parts for it.

loans.name: Victor Manuel Guadalupe

texts.es:
Víctor  tiene  55   años de edad,  él es casado ,  víctor cuenta con casa propia, la cual  esta ubicada  en  un centro poblado menor llamando  La Primavera, en la ciudad de  Chiclayo,  la cual cuenta con servicios básicos de aguay energía eléctrica

Víctor ,  cuenta con  una mototaxi (moto con una cabina para transportar pasajeros)  propia, con la cual brinda servicio de transporte público, con experiencia en el rubro, además labora como personal de limpieza en hotel 


Víctor a  solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  2000 nuevos soles. El destino del crédito es   para  mejoras en vivienda,  préstamo le permitirá  mejorar sus servicios higiénicos, para bienestar y comodidad  familiar.  
 
Víctor es un cliente nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa, con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Víctor, 55, is married.  He has a house of his own located in a small center of population called La Primavera in the city of Chiclayo; it has the basic utilities of water and electricity.

Víctor owns a mototaxi (a motorcycle with an attached cabin used to transport passengers) that he uses to provide public transportation services.  He has experience in this line of work.  He’s also employed as part of the cleaning crew in a hotel.

Víctor is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to carry out some home improvements.  The loan will make it possible to improve his home’s hygienic services for the family’s wellbeing and comfort.

Víctor is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa with good personal and work references.

loans.use: to carry out some home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the purchase of reeds for the manufacture of mats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make home-made candy.

loans.name: Flor Esterfilia

texts.es:
Flor  tiene 44 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos.  Vive en casa propia la cual esta ubicada en un pequeño sector llamado Cruz de la Esperanza en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Flor se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares, de oficina y productos escolares en su domicilio, desde hace 02 años.  A lo largo de este tiempo sus ventas se han visto en aumento en estos dos años en los cuales también ha ganado ganando la fidelidad de un  buen numero de clientes, los cuales están muy contentos con sus productos. 

Flor ha decidido solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000nuevos soles.  El destino del crédito será para la compra de más útiles escolares y para comprar un lote de productos de belleza que se encuentra en oferta. El cual le dará una mayor rentabilidad.

Flor  es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresaria y salir adelante.   Flor es una clienta nueva para Edpyme Alternativa, con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Flor is 44 years old and has 2 children. She lives in her own home located in a small area, Cruz de la Esperanza, in Chiclayo.

Flor has been selling writing materials for school or office and scholastic products in her home for 2 years. During these 2 years her sales have increased and she has also won the loyalty of a good number of clients, who are very happy with her products.

Flor has decided to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN. The loan will be used to buy more writing materials and a batch of beauty products currently on offer, which will provide her with greater profit.

Flor is quite a calm and responsible person. Her greatest desire is to be able to grow and progress as a business woman.  Flor is a new client for Edpyme Alternativa, with good personal and work references.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to further her business.

loans.name: Lily Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lily, nació en la mina la India una comarca localizada en el departamento de León, es madre de tres hijos, de oficio comerciante. Comenzó con capital propio pues antes su esposo era el único que mantenía a su familia, pero después ella decidió tener su negocio propio su esposo la apoyo incluso fue el quien le ayudo con una pequeña cantidad de dinero y así empezó a comprar inventario para su venta de ropa y zapatos. Fue ofreciendo a sus vecinos mas cercanos, vendía en la calles, fue tocando puerta a puerta ofertando su mercadería con el tiempo fue adquiriendo clientela fija. Además ella posee una pequeña pulpería dentro de su casa que es su otro medio de subsistencia la cual tiende ella misma, sus hijos al ayudan a atender esta pequeña pulpería. 
Solicito  el crédito para comprar inventario nuevo como zapatos, camisas, pantalones. Considera una temporada buena para incrementar sus ventas ya se acerca el día de la madre y espera aumentar sus ventas, mejorar sus ingresos y abastecer su inventario.
Desea realizarle mejoras de infraestructura a su hogar  expandir su negocio, tener una tienda de ropa en su casa. Su meta próxima es ahorrar para poder pagarles una carrera universitaria a sus hijos ya que para ella son su mayor prioridad.
texts.en:
Lily was born in the mining district of La India, an area located in the department of León. She is a mother to 3 children and a business woman. Previously, her husband was the only breadwinner but then she decided to start her own business. She started it with her own capital, her husband also supported her and even gave her a small amount of money, so she began buying stocks of clothing and shoes to sell. She would offer to sell them to her nearest neighbours, she sold them in the streets, she went door to door selling her merchandise, and over time she acquired a regular client base. She also runs a small general store in her own home, her other source of income. She works here herself with the help of her sons.

She is applying for this loan to buy new stocks of shoes, shirts and trousers. She believes it is a good season for increasing her sales as Mother's Day is approaching. She hopes to increase her sales, improve her income and sell her stock. She wishes to carry out improvements to the infrastructure of her home, expand her business, and have a clothes shop in her home. Her next goal is to be able to save enough money to pay for her children to attend university as they are her biggest priority.

loans.use: She is applying for the loan to purchase new stock such as shoes, shirts and trousers.

loans.name: Roger Martin

texts.es: El Sr. Roger tiene 31 años de edad vive en el barrio Villa Esperanza, en casa familiar con su conyugue la Sra. Mónica y su dos hijos menores de edad. Don Roger empezó trabajando como chofer hace 13 años y ya desde hace 6 años que tiene su propio micro y también es dueño de la línea. La Sra. Mónica (conyugue) se dedica a la venta de comida ayudándolo en los gastos de la casa. El crédito que se le otorgo es para la suspensión del techo de su micro y el mantenimiento en general. El Sr. es cliente nuevo y quedo muy agradecido con la agilidad del crédito y la oportunidad que le brindo la institución.
texts.en: Roger is 31 years old and lives in Villa Esperanza neighborhood.  He lives in his family home with his wife Mónica and their two dependent children.  Roger started working as a driver 13 years ago.  He has owned his own microbus for 6 years now and he also owns a route.  Roger's wife Mónica sells food which helps him to cover their household expenses.  Roger has been granted a loan which he will use to have work done on the roof of his bus and to have general maintenance work carried out.  Roger is a new client and he is very grateful for the speed with which he received his loan and the opportunity that the institution has given him.

loans.use: to have work done on the roof of his microbus and to have general maintenance work carried out on it

loans.name: Santos Sabino

texts.es:
Santos tiene 45 años de edad, él es soltero con 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia en un centro poblado menor de Salamanca del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz

Santos  se ha dedicado al negocio de la fabricación y venta de sandalias,   hace mas de 12 años, dicha actividad la realiza en su domicilio, en el que cuenta con un ayudante. Las productos terminados los vende en los mercados de Chiclayo y también las lleva por los pueblos de la sierra de Cajamarca.   

Santos ha decidido solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de  3000 nuevos soles.  El destino del crédito será para la comprar mas materia prima para la fabricación de sus producto que actualmente le están ofreciendo a bajo precio. De esta manera abastecer la demanda de sus clientes y por consiguiente le dará una mayor rentabilidad.

Santos es un cliente nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa, con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Santos is 45 years old, single, and has three children.  He lives in his own home in an area of Salamanca, in José Leonardo Ortiz district.

Santos has been making and selling sandals for more than 12 years.  He carries out his work from home and has an assistant.  He sells his finished products in the markets in Chiclayo.  He also takes some to sell in the villages in the mountains of Cajamarca.

Santos has decided to request a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use the loan to buy more raw materials for making his products which he is currently being offered at a low price.  In this way, he will be able to fulfill his customers' demands and thereby make more profits.

Santos is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa and he has good personal and work references.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for making sandals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to keep the meat she uses in her business fresh

loans.name: Patricio José

texts.es: Patricio Jose B. Amaya  de 63 años, es casado y padre de tres hijos en las edades de 30 a 33 años; él  tiene un negocio en una de las zonas más comerciales de la ciudad de Barranquilla y es el de vender jugos de naranjas, lo que la gente popularmente llama “el naranjazo”;  Proveniente de una familia numerosa de Lorica, población ubicada en el departamento de Córdoba y perteneciente a la costa Caribe de Colombia y con un nivel de educación primaria, ha logrado salir adelante con su familia desde que llegó con ellos a Barranquilla a “probar suerte”, pues logró apoyar a sus hijos en la educación hasta llevarlos a terminar carreras técnicas; el inició  con el negocio de preparar jugos de naranjas y hoy en todo el centro de la ciudad es muy reconocido por que su experiencia le ha permitido preparar  los más deliciosos e higiénicos productos naturales a base de naranja. Este es su tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando a su credikiva,  con el  comprará naranjas y mercancías pues últimamente ha adicionado un negocio donde vende productos variados,  como cosméticos, bolsos, billeteras, ropa, calzado, y todo lo que le encarguen y le ha ido muy bien;  Patricio aprovechando que  se acerca el día de las madres y le han hecho muchos pedidos, responderá de manera oportuna y esto lo hace sentir feliz. Con los financiamientos anteriores que ha conseguido en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ha logrado incursionar en la venta de otras mercancías, poner un local  contando con el apoyo de su esposa, porque su sueño mas adelante es tener un gran almacén en un corredor  comercial muy frecuentado y es este su principal desafío, pero mientras ocurre, sigue persistiendo en su trabajo que le ofrece una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor de 29%.
texts.en:
Patricio Jose B. Amaya is 63 years old, married, and has three children aged between 30 and 33.  He has a business in one of the most commercial areas of the city of Barranquilla where he sells orange juice which people popularly call 'el naranjazo'.  Patricio comes from a large family in Lorica, a town which is located in Córdoba department, on the Caribbean coast of Colombia, and he has an elementary school level of education.  He has managed to get ahead in life together with his family since he arrived with them in Barranquilla to "try his luck".  He managed to support his children in their education until they finished their technical degrees.  Patricio started out with a business making orange juice and now he is very well known in the whole city center because his experience has enabled him to prepare the most delicious and hygienic natural products with oranges.

This is Patricio's third loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he is applying for a Kiva loan to buy oranges and other merchandise as he has recently started an additional business selling a variety of products such as cosmetics, bags, billfolds, clothes, footwear and other things that people order from him.  His business has done very well.  Patricio is making the most of the fact that Mother's Day is approaching and people have placed a lot of orders with him.  He will be able to respond to these orders in a timely fashion and this makes him feel happy.

Through previous loans he has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Patricio has managed to start out in his business selling additional merchandise and set up a sales location with the support of his wife.  His dream for the future is to own a large store in a very busy commercial corridor and this is his main challenge.  While he waits for this to happen, he continues in his work which offers him a profit margin on his sales of not less than 29%.

loans.use: to buy oranges and merchandise such as cosmetics, bags, billfolds, clothes and footwear

loans.name: Maria Ledy

texts.es:
María es una mujer soltera de 48 años, vive en casa de unos familiares, la cual cuenta con todos los servicios básicos (agua, luz y desagüe), ubicada en el departamento de Lambayeque.  Zona caracterizada por desarrollar la actividada grícula, ganadera y turística.

María desde hace unos 2 años labora en el cafetín de un molina preparando y vendiendo comida para los trabajadores de ese lugar.  Labor que le ayuda a  tener ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos diarios.

Por eso María a solicitado un préstamo ha Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de utensilios (ollas, platos, cubiertos, etc.) de cocina que le hacen falta para seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela.

María trata todos los días que con su esfuerzo y trabajo tener mayores ingresos para cumplir el sueño de poder tener más adelante su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Maria is a 48 year old, single woman.  She lives in her relatives’ house, which has the basic services (water, electricity, and drainage).  The house is in the Lambayeque department.  The zone is noted for developing its agricultural, livestock, and tourist business activities.

For two years Maria has been working in a cafeteria at a mill.  She prepares and sells food to the workers in this area.  The work helps her to have income in order to be able to pay for her daily expenses.

That is why Maria is requesting a loan for 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativo.  She will buy kitchen utensils (pots, plates, and cutlery, etc.) that she needs to continue providing her customers with good service.

Maria tries every day so that with effort and work she will have greater income.  She wants greater income to be able to make her dream come true, which is to later on have her own restaurant.


.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Sebastiana Violeta

texts.es:
Sebastiana tiene 34 años de edad es casada y vive en casa de sus suegros, la cual esta ubicada en el distrito de Monsefú- Lambayeque, ciudad artesanal por referencia. 

El esposo de Sebastiana labora como obrero en una fábrica de dulces y ella cuenta con  un negocio en su domicilio, en el cual vende abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, huevos, aceite) y pollo. Sebastiana cuenta con más de 2 años de experiencia  en este negocio.

Sebastiana solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 600 nuevos soles, los cuales destinará en la compra de arroz y azúcar (que han subido de precio), pollo y  otros productos para su tienda.  

Este préstamo le permitirá  surtir su negocio con más variedad de productos,  lo que le dará mayores ventas y mejores ganancias,  sin tener que recurrir a préstamos indirectos  o prestamistas informales y con tasas por encima del promedio financiero.

Sebastiana es una clienta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 34 years old, married, and lives in her in-laws' home which is located in the city of Lambayeque, in Monsefú district.  Lambayeque is very much an artistic city.

Sebastiana's husband is a worker in a sweet factory and Sebastiana herself has a business in her home where she sells groceries (rice, sugar, eggs, oil) and chicken.  She has more than two years experience in this business.

Sebastiana is requesting a loan for 600 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy rice and sugar (which have risen in price), chicken and other products for her store.

This loan will allow Sebastiana to stock her business with a greater variety of products which will result in more sales and better profits without her having to access indirect loans or borrow from informal lenders who charge above-average interest rates.

Sebastiana is a client who has good personal and work references.

loans.use: to buy groceries and chicken to stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a pickup truck to transport her work equipment such as tables, chairs, ice box and seafood

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es un señor casado de 70 años de edad. El vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Nueva Arica – Chiclayo. Este distrito es conocido por ser una comunidad de comerciantes debido a que se encuentra cerca del mercado más popular de la ciudad, el mercado Modelo.

Oscar tiene varios años de experiencia en la cría de animales. Desde sus inicios el criaba ganado vacuno y ovino y fue allí donde aprendió sobre esta actividad. Actualmente él cría vacas, ovejas, caballos y cabras, que una vez se encuentren en las mejores condiciones, don Oscar los vende a comerciantes en el mercado Modelo.

Oscar solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles el cual destinará en la compra de nuevas crías y la compra del alimento balanceado que éstas necesitan.

Don Oscar es conocido en el mercado Modelo por ser un hombre muy trabajador y  honrado. Siempre vendiendo a precio justo su mercadería.
texts.en:
Oscar is 70 years old, married and lives with his wife in the Nueva Arica-Chiclayo district.  This area is known as a region of merchants since it is near the Modelo market, the most popular  in the city.

Oscar has years of experience raising animals.  From the beginning  he raised cattle and sheep and that’s how he learned.  Now he has cows, sheep, horses and goats, that once they have reached a good size, he sells them to the merchants in Modelo Market.

Oscar is requesting a loan of 2,000 new soles to use in the purchase of new animals and the balanced feed that they need.

This gentleman is known in the market as a hardworking and honorable man who always sells at a fair price.

loans.use: To buy new animals and food for them

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana tiene 27 años de edad y vive con su esposo e hijo en el Caserío Guaraguaos Alto en el Distrito Tambogrande – Piura. Clienta vive en la parte rural de este distrito.

El esposo de Juana es obrero de construcción y con su sueldo cubre los gastos familiares. Juana contribuye a los gastos familiares con el dinero ganado por la venta de productos de farmacia y también de gaseosas, jugos, bodoques, entre otros. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años en  su propio domicilio en el cual atiende permanentemente.

Juana solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería, como alcohol, algodón, gasas, vendas, etc. Que le permitirá seguir ampliando su negocio y los niveles de sus ventas aumentarán.

Juana en un futuro desea ampliar su tienda ofreciendo productos de mejor calidad y más variados. Juana goza de muy buenas referencias personales, por sacar de apuros, con sus productos,  a los clientes de su zona.
texts.en:
Juana is 27 years old and lives with her husband and son in the rural settlement Guaraguaos Alto in the Tambogrande-Piura district.  

Juana's husband is a construction worker and his income covers the family expenses.  Juana contributes to the family expenses with the money she earns selling pharmacy products as well as sodas, juices, bodoques [frozen treats served in plastic bags] among other things.  She has been constantly attending to this business for 2 years from her own house.  
 
Juana is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 500 nuevos soles to purchase merchandise such as alcohol, cotton, gauze, bandages, etc.  This will allow her to continue expanding her business and increase her sales.  

In the future, Juana would like to expand her store and offer better quality products and a wider variety.  Juana has good personal references because she helps her customers during hard times with her products.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store such as alcohol, cotton, gauze and bandages.

loans.name: Aby Stella

texts.es: Aby G. G., de 40 años vive en el barrio Villa Paraíso con su esposo y sus hijos de 7 y 13 años;  ella es contadora publica de profesión,  y empresaria confeccionista por vocación,  actividad que desempeña desde un taller en su propia casa y que aprendió desde sus 12 años por tradición familiar, porque su madre, con la que aun trabaja,  la enseñó.  Inicialmente Aby  pegaba  botones y realizaba tareas adicionales sencillas  propias de la confección, hasta que montó su propio taller, y decidió aprender técnicamente todas las operaciones de esta actividad, como el diseño, corte preparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas. En la actualidad su línea preferida es la femenina y enfrenta un gran desafío, que es la competencia y la ropa importada resulta más económica, sin embargo ella está estudiando sus propias posibilidades de compra por volúmenes, para ofrecer servicios de mejor calidad como las que ella fabrica, a precios más competitivos. Su meta más adelante es conquistar nuevos clientes aumentar sus niveles de producción y con ello sus utilidades, por eso recurre a su credikiva que es su primer financiamiento, con el cual comprará    en mayores volúmenes telas, hilos, encajes, botones y accesorios para hacer una producción dirigida a mujeres,  pues  le  han encargado vestidos a la medida de las circunstancias, porque desean lucir muy bellas con motivo de la celebración del día universal de las madres.
texts.en:
Aby G. G. is 40 years old and lives in Villa Paraíso neighborhood together with her husband and her children aged 7 and 13.  She is a certified public accountant by profession and a dressmaker by vocation.  She carries out her work from a workshop in her own home.  She learned the trade, which is a family tradition, at the age of 12.  She was taught by her mother who she still works with.

Initially, Aby stuck on buttons and carried out other simple dressmaking tasks until she set up her own workshop and decided to learn all the tasks involved in the business such as designing, cutting, preparing, assembling and finishing off garments.  Currently, Aby's favorite line is women's clothing.  She faces a great challenge in the form of competition and imported clothes which are cheaper.  However, she is studying the possibility of buying in bulk so that she can offer better quality services with the clothes that she makes, at more competitive prices.  Her goal for the future is to attract new customers, increase her production levels and increase her profits.  For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan which is her first loan.  She will use the money to buy larger quantities of fabric, threads, lace, buttons and accessories so that she can produce women's clothing as she has orders for dresses from people who want to look beautiful for celebrating Mother's Day.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, lace, buttons and accessories in larger quantities

loans.name: Vanik

texts.en:
Vanik G. was born in 1951 and he lives in Dovegh village, in the area of Ijevan. Vanik is married and has three children: two sons and a daughter. For a long time, Vanik worked as a tractor driver and he is now engaged in farming. With his family's help, Vanik breeds two cows, two calves and three pigs. He also has a kitchen garden where he grows potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers for his family and onions for sale.

Vanik has received four loans from Nor Horizon and he is now asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a sow, 2 or 3 calves and fodder for his farm animals. Vanik says his will use the farm’s future income for his younger son’s wedding.

loans.use: To buy a sow, calves and fodder.

loans.name: Areta

texts.en:
Areta Maruqyan is 55 years old and lives in Vanadzor. She has two sons and one daughter. Two of her children are married and live separately and one son, still single, lives with Areta and her husband.

Areta and her husband opened a shop across from their house three years ago, but they have been in this business for 13 years. They sell groceries and household goods such oil, paper goods, towels, toys, jam, soap, etc. The profits from the sales allow them to take care of the family's needs. Areta is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to buy sausages, macaroni, coffee, tea, household goods and other items for her shop. This is Areta’s 8th loan form Nor Horizon and 2nd loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy sausages, macaroni, coffee, tea and household goods for her shop.

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en: Amalya A. lives in Vanadzor with her husband. Amalya’s three daughters are already married and live separately from their parents. Amalya works as a nurse and simultaneously she and her husband have been running their shop for more than 6 years. They sell towels, bedspreads, tableware, kitchen utensils, tea items, vases, souvenirs, etc. Their business’s incomes make it possible to provide for their family. Amalya needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy dishes, tea and coffee sets, pans, etc. to resell. This is Amalya's second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy dishes, tea and coffee sets, pans, etc. to resell

loans.name: Barbara Guilliana

texts.es:
Barbara es una madre D. familia D. 48 años D. edad, vive con su hijo en su casa propia la cula cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito D. Olmos a unos 40 minutos del departamento D. Lambayeque.  Estas zonas se caracterizan por su alta actividad comercial, agricola y turismo que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Barbara ha puesto  en su casa una bodega a la cual se dedica  hace varios años.  En su bodega sus vecinos encuentran toda clase D. productos comestibles, con la venta D. su productos obtendra un mejor nivel D. vida.

Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa Barbara trata D. poder adquirir un préstamo D. 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más productos para su tienda para obtener mayores ganacias.

Barbara es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer  alegre, dispuesta a ayudar a otros y una madre responsable con el objetivo D. que hija salgan adelante apunta D. esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Barbara is a 48 year old housewife. She lives with her child in her own house which has all the basic services and is located in the Olmos district, about 40 minutes from the department of Lambayeque. These areas are characterized by a lot of business activity, farming, and tourism that their inhabitants are developing.

For several years, Barbara has had a grocery shop in her house. In her shop, her neighbors find all kinds of edible products. Through the sale of these products she will obtain a better quality of life. By means of a visit to Epydme Alternative Barbara has applied for a loan of 1500 new soles in order to purchase more products for her shop so that she can obtain greater earnings.

Barbara is known to her neighbors as a happy women determined to help others and as a responsible mother. Her goal is for her child to get ahead as a result of her effort and work

loans.use: to purchase more products in order to stock her shop.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco tiene ya más de seis años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de comida preparada. 
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta equipo de inmobiliario nuevo y hacerle algunas reparaciones al local. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el equipo y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejorar al negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con algunas partes de las ganancias que obtiene del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Francisco has had a business making and selling prepared food items for more than 6 years.  He needs some new equipment for his business and also needs to make some repairs to the premises.  He is requesting a loan so that he can buy the equipment and pay a person to make the repairs.  He plans to pay back this loan with part of the earnings he gets from his business, as this business is the source of income that he uses to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy equipment and make repairs to his business premises

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es: Carlos Arturo M. D. L. H. tiene 55 años y vive en el barrio Las Palmas D. L. ciudad D. BarranquilL., con su cónyuge y sus 5 hijos en las edades D. 18 a 35 años; allí se dedica a L. preparación D. almuerzos especialmente comidas corrientes.  Carlos Inició su  negocio D. comidas hace 25 años al lado D. su madre y elL. finalmente se lo cedió hace 5 años, debido a que por su edad debió retirarse;  desD. ese mismo momento empezó su cónyuge, él y su hija a fabricar almuerzos, comidas y en un futuro abrirá L. línea D. desayunos.  Su credikiva  es el primer financiamiento que recibe D. L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él comprará  una carpa para protegerse del sol y D. L. lluvia, adecuará su local  y comprará 4 juegos D. sillas y 9 mesas con las cuales repondrá las D. madera que están en deterioro.  D. esta manera  brindará una mejor atención a sus clientes, quienes se sentirán confortables en su establecimiento cuando vayan  a alimentarse y el conservará o aumentará L. rentabilidad sobre las ventas que es no menor del 549%. Su sueño ahora es seguirse posicionando hasta lograr mucho prestigio en L. comunidad y su máximo desafío es  comprar L. carpa D. inmediato antes D. que llegue con fuerza L. oL. invernal a L. región.
texts.en: Carlos Arturo M. D. L. H. is 55 years old and lives in the Las Palmas neighborhood of the city of BarranquilL. with his wife and their 5 children aged 18 to 35.  Here he has a business making lunches, especially fast food.  Carlos started his food business 25 years ago along with his mother.  She finally left him the business 5 years ago, because due to her age she had to retire.  From this moment on he began working with his wife and daughter making lunches, meals, and in the future they will open a breakfast business.  This Kiva loan is the first loan that he has received from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with it he will buy a tarp to protect him from the sun and the rain, he will upgraD. his place of business, and he will buy 4 sets of chairs and 9 tables which will replace the wooden ones that he has that are deteriorated.  In this way he will proviD. better service to his customers, who want to feel comfortable in his establishment when they come there to eat, and he will retain or increase the profitability of his sales, which is not less than 549%.  His dream now is to continue to position himself to achieve great prestige in the community, and his main desire is to buy a tarp right before the rainy season begins in the region.

loans.use: to buy a tarp to protect him from the sun and the rain, to make improvements to his place of business, and to buy 4 sets of chairs and 9 tables to replace ones that he has that are deteriorated

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new taxi and meet living expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some modern tools and other equipment for his metal shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to take a shop for rent in a fair place

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine, different kinds of threads and other things

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new engine for his taxi and solve his problems

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to reconstruct the family house, which was destroyed during the war

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase nuts and coffee grains to launch a coffee-roasting house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to move his fruit and vegetable vending business from a cart to a permanent storefront

loans.name: Mabondeli Plus Group

texts.en:
Annie is the chairwoman of a community bank named “Mabondeli Plus” which means prayer in English. The group is composed of 18 micro-entrepreneurs united to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their individual businesses.

Annie is 43 years old and married with three children between the ages of 12 and 18. All of her children go to school. Annie started her business in 1988 selling beans and rice and today she operates a restaurant located in the heart of Kinshasa. Her restaurant has prospered thanks to Hope’s loans and Annie is able to increase her working capital with her daily profit of about 30 USD. 

Annie is happy to be part of one of MFI Hope’s groups. She joined the group in 2010 and her business has been strengthened through the seven loans she has received and repaid from MFI Hope DRC. In the future, Annie’s dream is to diversify her business by opening a beverage facility.

loans.use: to increase her restaurant inventory and strengthen her business

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Totosa Plus Group

texts.en:
“Totosa Plus” is a group composed of 17 small-business owners. Its chairwoman is Virginie. The group's members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Virginie is 44 years old and the divorced mother of four children between seven and 22. All of her children go to school. Virginie is determined to be a successful businesswoman. She sells pagnes (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) at a market located north-east of Kinshasa and currently earns a weekly profit of 40 USD. She has been in this business for years and has acquired solid experience. Virginie has previously repaid eight loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC. She intends to use this loan to expand her inventory and will buy more pagnes to resell at a profit to increase her income. In the future, Virginie will seek to make more profit by importing her products herself.

loans.use: to purchase brightly colored African cloth to expand her business inventory

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase stylish clothes to sell

loans.name: Amen Plus Group

texts.en:
Jeanine is the leader of a community bank named “Amen Plus” which is composed of 12 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to obtain loans from Kiva through the microfinance institution HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their individual businesses.
 
Jeanine is 49 years old and the single mother of four children between the ages of 26 and 33. Two of her children attend school. Jeanine sells beans and rice in the northeastern area of Kinshasa. She has been in business for years and currently makes about 150 USD weekly. Jeanine is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE DRC and has successfully repaid ten previous loans. 

Jeanine will use her loan to increase her inventory of goods by purchasing sacks of beans to sell. In the future, she dreams of diversifying her business by opening a beverage facility in her store.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a carpet weaving frame and materials for her business

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a 30-year-old man from Jabalia Refugee camp in Gaza Strip. Ismael is an accountant in a textile factory in Jabalia. Ismael got married recently and even though he is an employee with a decent salary, he couldn't furnish his house. Ismael took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the furniture that the family needs.

Ismael is photographed in the picture above.

loans.use: to purchase home furniture

loans.name: Las Minas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Minas esta formado por 11 mujeres luchadoras, emprendedoras que siempre ven la vida con optimismo, laboran en diferentes actividades que les permiten aportar a  la economía de sus hogares y sacar  adelante a sus hijos. Viven por la comunidad de Las Minas que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia tiene hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales o a la agricultura, muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a ejercer varios trabajos, el Valle tiene personas muy amables y cordiales que mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. María Felicia S. vive en la comunidad de Las Minas, tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, dos son  casados e independientes, uno de 20 años que trabaja y le ayuda economícamente, su hijo de  13 años le ayuda en la casa, sus dos siguientes hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad y su ultimo hijo que tiene de 2 años de edad. Su esposo labora como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña María se dedica a la cría de  pollos y cuyes los mismos que los vende en su comunidad, también se dedica a tejer sombreros de paja toquilla ya que aprendió esta actividad por habilidad, sus productos los vende a su selecta clientela.
 
Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y en su alimento.

Su meta es criar más animales como chanchos.
texts.en:
The Las Minas communal bank is made up of 11 tenacious and enterprising women who always view life with optimism. They work in different businesses that permit them to contribute to the upkeep of their households and the progress of their children.

They live in the community of Las Minas which is a part of the parish of El Valle. This parish has beautiful scenery. Its people are involved in raising animals or farming. Many go to the city every day to carry out various jobs. The people of El Valle are very friendly and cordial and maintain their traditional culture.

Señora María Felicia S. lives in Las Minas. She is 40 years old, married, and has 7 children. Two are married and independent. A 20 year old works and helps support the family. Her 13 year old son helps around the house. Her two next youngest children study in the local school, and her youngest is two years old. Her husband is a construction worker. Together they have succeeded in building their own house.

Doña María raises chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in her community. She also weaves straw shawls. She became proficient in this activity and sells her products to a select group of customers.

This is the third loan that she is seeking through the communal bank, which a friend invited her to join. She is going to invest the loan in purchasing guinea pigs and animal feed. Her goal is to raise more animals such as pigs.

loans.use: to purchase animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Govi-Altai Province, Mongolia. His two children, ages 13 and 16, both attend local secondary school.

With the help of his older brother, Battulga manages a wooden product-making business that he started in 2007; his wife helps to paint and wax those products. After gaining much experience and building up his clientele, he was able to move his production from his backyard to a workshop ger. Battulga now owns sufficient equipment to produce quality wooden products that are well-known amongst his customers.

An honest and hardworking man who says, "Life is good," he is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of wood for his business.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of wood.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian L., from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, is 37 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Vivian has been planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale for over a year, and earning approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Vivian joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, she is requesting her second loan of 5000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Vivian plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 25 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Govi-Altai Province, Mongolia. Her daughter goes to a kindergarten, while her husband, who works in a mining company, earns a monthly salary of 650,000 MNT.

Narantsetseg manages a clothing-trading business in a rented stall at a trading center, and has gained much experience since starting the enterprise in 2007. She is very adept at collecting and purchasing stylish and quality products for her business, so her customers are happy to patronize her stall. She also offers barter trading for local residents in order to make her business more accessible.

A hardworking lady who says, "One will succeed if she has a positive attitude," Narantsetseg is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to import products from China to sell in the coming summer. She is planning to buy a house and a car with her business profits.

loans.use: to import clothing products from China.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina T. is from the village of Mitugas, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old. Saturnina is widowed and has five adult children. Saturnina owns and operates a retail business, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Saturnina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Saturnina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Saturnina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Saturnina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase rice and corn grits to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Saturnina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Ariunzaya

texts.en:
Ariunzaya is 23 years old and lives with her husband and only son in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She manages a household appliance trading business at a rented stall at Narantuul market, one of the biggest markets in Ulaanbaatar city. She started her business with the help of her husband in 2006. 

Before starting up her business operation, she gained enough experience by working as a salesperson at her older sister's grocery booth. She has worked hard to expand and stabilize her business. She is an open-minded and diligent woman who says, "I am planning to continue my business for the future." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase antennas in order to increase her business sales.

loans.use: To purchase antennas from Erlian.

loans.name: Oyunzul

texts.en: Oyunzul T. is 36 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom attend school.  Her husband is a taxi driver. They live in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. Oyunzul manages a clothing trading business at her older sister's booth at a trading center. She started her business in 2007. In order to supplement her family earning, she began a porcelain trading business in 2009. She also offers barter trading for her customers. She is planning to have her own booth in the future. She is a patient and diligent woman who says, "One will succeed if she has a big dream." She is requesting a loan for 1,500,000 MNT, which she will use to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing inventory

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita A. is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Lita is married and has three adult children. Lita owns and operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Lita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Lita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for additional capital for her business. Lita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Lita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sodnomdarjaa

texts.en: Sodnomdarjaa Z. is 41 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom attend school. They live in a rented apartment in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He manages a grocery trading business with the help of his wife. He started his business in 2010.  In addition, he operates taxi service business in order to supplement his family's income. Generally, his wife is responsible for the grocery trading business. Sodnomdarjaa is serious man who says, "I am planning to have my own house with the savings." He is requesting a loan for 2,750,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase a plot of land to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land to build a house

loans.name: Sumiya

texts.en:
Sumiya B. is 47 years old and lives with her son and her daughter in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her son is unemployed and her daughter is a student. 

She manages a meat-trading business in her town. She started her business in 2005 and has gained much experience. With her business profit she is able to feed her family and pay the tuition cost of her daughter. 

She is planning to build a house in the future. She is a polite woman who says, "I want to have a house where my family can live happily." 

She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of meat in order to sell it in spring time.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat to sell

loans.name: Cornilla

texts.en:
Cornilla V. is from the village of Militar. She is 43 years old. Cornilla is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Cornilla owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Cornilla has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Cornilla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.
