Cornilla is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase dried fish, bagoong (fish paste) and soft drinks for resale. This will be the first loan taken out by Cornilla from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish, bagoong and soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Leonardo S

texts.en:
Leonardo S N. is from the village of Tagulalo, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 60 years old. Leonardo is married and has an adult child. 

To make a living, Leonardo owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Leonardo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. 

Leonardo is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to  purchase bagoong (fish paste), rice and soft drinks for resale. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Leonardo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase bagoong, rice and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Thelma C. works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from sari-sari (variety) store. Thelma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish for her dried fish business.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita S. is from the village of Sto. Niño. She is 64 years old. Rosita is widowed and has nine adult children. 

To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a retail store, selling animal feed and farm-related products. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rosita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like a table and a carving knife for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like a table and a carving knife.

loans.name: Lorene

texts.en:
Lorene is 24 years old and has a common-law husband and one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lorene has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Lorene has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Lorene has been in this business for five years.  In the future, Lorene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell in her store

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 50 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are in school.

Ruth is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Ruth has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs and feed.

Ruth has been raising pigs for 18 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ruth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed

loans.name: Joygie

texts.en:
Joygie is 45 years old, married and has seven children, three of whom are in school. 

Joygie is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Joygie has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Joygie has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Joygie would like to save enough money so she could continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. is from the village of Tagulalo, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 64 years old. Lydia is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling products to local businesses and community members. Lydia has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lydia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to  purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to  purchase raw materials to manufacture new products and to pay for the labor cost. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lydia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to  purchase raw materials to manufacture new products and to pay for the labor cost

loans.name: Jelyn

She runs a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling livestocks.  Jelyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell in her used clothing business.

Jelyn has sustained her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase of additional bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Ishdorj

texts.en:
Mr. Ishdorj is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Ishdorj runs a taxi business using his family car. His wife looks after the baby at the moment.

 Ishdorj also runs a small farm with around 20 animals. His six cows are expected to give  birth soon. Ishdorj milks the cows with his wife's help and sells fresh milk and dairy products to his neighbors. Ishdorj is very hard-working and enthusiastic person. Last year he dug a well for water on his land and planted vegetables. He was overwhelmed with the harvest and it gave him a big inspiration. Now he is planning to buy a 84 sq. meter greenhouse which consists of a metal frame and polyethylene film and grow vegetables such as tomatoes, cucumbers, lettuces and so on. 

Ishdorj's family is very happy that now they will be able to use their own dairy products and vegetables all year around. The loan Mr.Ishdorj is requesting will be used to buy a greenhouse and vegetable seeds to grow vegetables for his family use.

loans.use: To buy a greenhouse and vegetable seeds and grow vegetables for family use.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Mr. Battulga is 36 years old and works as a taxi driver. He has been running a taxi business since 2001. He used to work for the State-owned taxi company and when the company was privatized, he bought his car on a leasing contract and successfully paid it off. 

Battulga lives with his mother in his mother’s apartment. A few years ago, he separated from his wife. Now he has met another woman and he is planning to marry her and start a new life. He has a small plot of land,  and at the moment he is planning to build a family house on it. He is going to finance the project from his savings, but still needs some money on top. The loan he is taking will be used to buy necessary building materials to build a family house on his plot of land.

loans.use: To buy necessary building materials to build a family house on his plot of land.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta R. is a 62-year-old, married woman from the village of Guba Clarin Misamis Occidental. She and her husband have three adult-age children. To earn a living, Julieta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. Specifically, her primary source of income is derived from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Julieta joined GDMPC to gain much-needed access to financial services. In turn, she was better able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her standard of living. Recently, Julieta successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Julieta is now requesting a new loan, this time in the amount of 20,000 PHP ($475), which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Notably, this loan would be the third loan taken out by Julieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyuntsetseg T. is 50-year-old woman, living with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Their children are grownups, all of whom live separately with their own families.

Oyuntsetseg is a businesswoman who uses every opportunity to earn money and to improve her family's standard of living. She explains that she provides monetary support to her children as well. Three years ago she and her husband built a house next to their residence. They refurbished the newly-built house so that it has studio apartments with furniture, which they rent to university students. Students like the location because it is right in the center of the city (and is therefore close to all amenities) and because the apartments are affordable.

She and her husband have other means of generating income. Oyuntsetseg’s husband, Bolor, is an auto mechanic. He uses his own garage as a workshop, where he fixes cars. Oyuntsetseg, meanwhile, uses one of her rooms at home as a workshop, where she runs a tailoring business. Specifically, she makes and fixes dresses in accordance with her customers' orders.

They bought a small plot of land in a peaceful suburb of Ulaanbaatar, and they are currently building a family house there. She now needs some extra funding to complete the house. As such, Oyuntsetseg is seeking a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 MNT ($825), which will be used to buy building materials such as cement, bricks, and paint to complete the house.

loans.use: To complete construction of their house by purchasing building materials (e.g., cement, bricks, and paint).

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Chinda K. (pictured) is 25 years old. Her husband, Mr. Vannak Seur, is 33 years old. They live along National Road 2, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2003, and they have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children are in school, while the other child is still too young for school.

To earn a living and to support her family, Mrs. Chinda K. sells fish in a market that is approximately four kilometers from her house. Her husband, meanwhile, is a construction contractor. She is seeking her first loan, in the amount of $200, to buy additional fish for re-sale purposes.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional fish.

Yom produces bags from recycled materials. His wife is a garment factory worker. Yom is asking for his first loan of $500 to purchase another sewing machine which with to sew the bags.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en: Priscah B. is married and has four children, all of whom attend school.  She is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya and has been farming for four years producing milk and selling to Kenya Co-operative Creameries. She employs two  farmhands. Priscah has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to start poultry farming. She will use the loan to buy chickens and believes the income generated will complement her dairy income, help pay school fees for her children, and provide daily meals. She is also focusing on starting a biogas system with her dairy cows to provide the family with energy. Priscah points at the network of poor roads as an impediment to dairy farming but appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's financial services.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

Eddah has made a request for a loan amounting to 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her purchase poultry. She says she wants to venture into the poultry business to supplement income from dairy which experiences frequent price fluctuations. She adds that the income from farming has been helping her in paying for the education of the children.

She is optimistic, saying the businesses will improve significantly in the future.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her shop

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ar: عزيزة امراة متزوجة وهي ام لولد لها من العمر 45 سنة هي امراة عاملة نشيطة ومحبة للعمل لها في عملها 3 سنوات تعمل في بيع الالبسة والاحذية والاكسسوارات تريد ان تحسن في وضعها المادي والاجتماعي وان تؤمن مستقبل جيد لولدها فهي امراة عطوفة وتريد ان ترقى بعائلتها الى احسن الاحوال تعمل منذ وقت وقد استطاعت من خلال القرض السابق من المجموعة الى استاجار محل خاص بها والان تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة للمحل لدعم عملها وتحسين وضع المدخول تعاني من بعض الصعوبات المادية التي تحول دون تطور العمل ولكنها وبفضل المثابرة والعمل الجيد والتمييز بالاسعار وخبرتها في العمل وزبائنها تستطيع وبفضل الدعم المادي من خلال القرض ان تزيد من مدخولها وتحسن وضعها
texts.en: Aziza is 45 years old and married with a son. She is an active working woman who loves her business. She has been running a clothes, shoes and accessories store for three years. She would like to improve her financial and social situation and secure a good future for her son, as she is a compassionate woman who wants to progress for herself and her family. The last loan assisted her in renting her own shop, and with this loan she wants to purchase new stock, support her store, and increase her income. She suffers some financial issues which prevent the development of her business. However, with perseverance, good work, competitive prices, her experience with the business and her customers, as well as with the financial support from the loan, she is able to increase her income and improve her circumstances.

loans.use: to buy new stock for her store.

loans.name: Simon Waweru

texts.en:
Simon Waweru is 48 years old married to Mary Wambui, who contributes to the family income. He has four children aged 23, 21, 15 and 7 years old. He has been running his business for a period of about five years, with an income of 13,000 Kenya shillings a month.

He is applying for a first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a friend. He wants to use the loan to buy binding materials. 

He hopes to establish a bigger workshop which will provide services to the community and with the profit improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy binding materials.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice I. is married and has four children, three of whom attend school.  She a resident of Kitale area in Western Kenya and has been farming for three years producing eggs and selling to the local market. She employs three farmhands.  Alice is requesting her second loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 60,000 KES, which she will use to expand her poultry business. Her first loan for 30,000 KES helped her establish her farm. She says she has a target of rearing up to 3,000 birds and this second loan will help her achieve that goal. She adds that her family solely relies on the farming income for their upkeep. Alice notes that poultry diseases are a great challenge but is optimistic that they are manageable.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens

loans.name: Stanely Gavole

texts.en: Stanely Gavole L. is 39 years old, married, and has one child. He has been running his farm for a period of about three years with an income of 9,000 KES a month. He also has a grocery store where he sells his vegetables from the farm. This is Stanely's first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a group member. He wants to use the loan to rent more land for farming and to buy seedlings. He hopes to own land and develop it in order to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to rent more land for farming and to buy seedlings

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي رجل متزوج واب لأربع اولاد عمره 33 سنة يعمل في بيع المواشي والاغنام واللحوم له في عمله منذ 3 سنوات يحب عمله ويستطيع ان يطوره بفضل مجهوده وحبه للعمل يلقى بعض الصعوبات المادية التي تعيق هذا التقدم له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه وبعض التجار يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة من المواشي الاغنام للتجارة بها حتى يتمكن من تطوير العمل وتحسين الوضع المادي له ولعائلته وخاصة انه اب لأربع اولاد حيث يقوم بتربيتهم وتعليمهم وهذا من طموحاته ان يؤمن لهم التعليم الجيد والعيش الكريم هو اب حنون عطوف ويحب ان يكون المجتمع الذي يعيش فيه هو بيئة جيدة ماديا واجتماعيا لأولاده
texts.en: Ali is 33 years old and married with four children. He sells of livestock (cattle and sheep) and meat. He has three years experience in this. He loves his work and is able to develop it due to his effort, but he faces some financial difficulties which hinder his progress. His customers range from local residents and neighbours, as well as some businessmen. With this loan he wants to purchase new cattle and sheep in order to trade them so that he is able to improve his and his family's financial situation. This is important to him as he is the father of four children and wants to give them a comfortable life and the best possible education. He is a caring and compassionate father and would like the society he lives in to be a good physical and social environment for his children.

loans.use: to buy new herds of cattle and sheep for trade.

loans.name: Ramel

texts.en:
Ramel is from the village of Tuburan, Villaflor, Oroquieta City. He is 30 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. He owns and operates a general store. 

Ramel has been engaged in his business for three years and earns approximately 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. Ramel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. 

Ramel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP with which he will purchase more inventory. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ramel from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About PMPC 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products such as shampoo, soap, dried goods, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old Lebanese married man. He is living with his wife and four young children who are still attending school. He has 23 years of experience working in the car mechanic field and has owned a small shop for 18 years. His work is specialized in selling car radiators and repairing the damaged ones. He has a part-time employee helping him do the work. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his shop’s inventory in order to enhance his sales and earn higher profits. He is looking to diversify his business and open a new shop where he can buy and sell spare car parts. His income is needed to help support his wife and four children.

loans.use: to increase his shop’s inventory

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.ar: محمد متزوج عمره 37 سنة اب لخمسة اولاد يعمل في بيع الهواتف النقالة وخطوط التعبئة وقطع الغيار له في عمله 4 سنوات يحب العمل هو اولى اهتماماته يريد ان يطور العمل وان يجدد حتى يتمكن من تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي يريد ان يعتمد على نفسه في زيادة المدخول حتى يستطيع ان يؤمن لاولاده التعليم الجيد والعيش الكريم ماديا واجتماعيا هو رجل طموح محب للعمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة هواتف نقالة وخطوط تعبئة للهواتف النقالة وقطع غيار للصيانة يتميز بالذكاء في العمل والدقة والمثابرة على التطور والتجديد له زبائن يقصدونه من محيطه وجيرانه لكن بعض الصعوبات المادية هي التي تعيق تطور العمل وتأمن المنافسة المتوازنة مع غيره في محيطه العملي
texts.en: Mohamed is a 37-year-old married father of five children. He works in the business of selling mobile phones, mobile phone parts, and top-up cards and has been doing this for four years. He loves his work and it is one of his foremost priorities.  He would like to develop and rejuvenate his business so that he can improve his financial and social situation and be independent. He would also like to increase his income in order to be able to provide his children with a comfortable standard of living financially and socially, as well as give them the best education possible. He is an ambitious man who loves his work and with this loan he wants to buy new inventory. He is distinguished for his intelligence, precision and his perseverance in seeking development for his business. He has many loyal customers from his neighbours and local area, but lack of financial capital hinders his progress as well as some balanced competition from others in his local area.

loans.use: to purchase new mobile phones, mobile phone parts (for repair) and mobile. phone top-ups for his shop

loans.name: James Wanyoike

texts.en:
James wanyoike is 41 years old married to Charity who contributes to the family income. He has been running his business for a period of about two years with an income of approximately 5,000 Kenyan shillings in a month. 

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by a group member. He wants to use the loan to buy a piece of land to develop. He hopes to have a fleet of motorcycles to create employment and improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land to develop.

loans.name: Hasna

texts.ar: حسنا امرأة متزوجة وهي ام لولد هي عمرها 45 سنة تعمل في بيع الاكسسورات والعطورات من منزلها فهي مكافحة محبة للعمل ومثابرة على تحسين الاوضاع المادية لها ولعائلتها لها في عملها سنتين حيث استطاعت ان تزيد من البضاعة القليلة في منزلها واصبح لديها عدد اكبر من الزبائن لكنها وبفضل طموحها وحبها للتطور تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة عطورات واكسسوارات لتزيد من المدخول وهي تمطح بأن تصبح بعد ان تؤمن عدد اكبر من الزبائن والبضاعة ان تصبح تمتلك محل خاص بها تستطيع من خلاله التوسع وتغيير الواقع المادي والاجتماعي السيء بعض الشيء حيث انها تريد ان تؤمن مستقبل جيد لها ولعائلتها وتعلم اولادها بشكل افضل فهي لا تكف عن التفكير بتعليم اولادها وتحسين واقعها المادي وهي امراة عاملة محبة لعملها ومكافحة لأجل عائلتها
texts.en: Hasna is45 years old and married with a son. She works selling fashion accessories and perfumes from home. She has been doing this for two years and has been able to increase from her small initial stock to a large number of customers. She loves what she does and constantly strives to improve her family's financial situation. However, due to her ambitious nature and love for development, with this loan she wants to purchase new perfumes and accessories in order to increase her income. After securing more stock and customers, she aspires to have her own shop through which she can expand and change her poor financial and social situation, little by little. She also wants to secure a good future for herself and her family and provide a good education for her children. Her children's education and improving her financial situation are things she is constantly thinking of as she is a woman who loves her business and struggles for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to buy new fashion accessories and perfumes for her home-based business.

loans.name: Hilder

texts.en:
Hilder, 52, is a mother two children aged 21 and 14. She has been doing poultry farming in Kitale town in Kenya and employs two farmhands, selling her eggs to the local market. 

Hilder has requested a loan of 62,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says she wants to spread her farming risk since poultry diseases have become very rampant leading to great losses. She hopes the income will be enough to cater for the family meals and the children's education. She is focusing on owning a pick-up to help in transportation of her produce as well as do the business by providing transportation to other farmers. 

She notes that transportation costs and poultry diseases are their major threats.

loans.use: to pay for dairy unit construction and to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline M. is 33 years old and is married with three children aged between 3 and 7 years. 

She sells various item such as lotion, soap, sugar, rice, etc in her boutique. Her business is well-organized. Joseline has three year's experience in her business and she works from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via vision finance company in order to purchase more items such as lotion, soap, sugar, biscuits, eggs, etc., to sell. With any profit, Joseline will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more items such as lotion, soap and sugar to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married man living with his wife and four young children. He is from Lebanon. He is the main income provider of his family. He has 22 years of experience working as a farmer. He has been managing his own farm since 1990. His farm produces all types of vegetables, which are all distributed to local agricultural markets. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase agricultural spices and seeds. In addition, he will buy some supplies needed for his work in order to improve his business.  He expects that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural spices, seeds and supplies

loans.name: Peter Mwihia

texts.en:
Peter Mwihia is a 43-year-old businessman. He supports his wife and children. He has been running his motorcycle business for a period of about two years with an income of about 13,000 Kenyan shillings a month. 

This is his first loan after being introduced to KADET by a staff member. He wants to use the loan to buy a piece of land with his other group members. 

In the future he hopes to build rental houses and improve his living standard.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land

loans.name: Almalyn

texts.en:
Almalyn is from the village of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is 30 years old, married, and has four adult children. Almalyn has a business fattening hogs. 

Almalyn has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. Almalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. 

Almalyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP with which she will purchase pig feed. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Almalyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About PMPC 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her piggery

location.town: San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Penina Odera

texts.en:
Peninah Odera is 48 years old and married to George Otieno.  She has two children and has been running her outside catering business for a period of about 10 years with an income of approximately 4,000 Kenya shillings a month.

She is taking her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one.  She wants to use the loan to install water pipes in her business premise. 

She hopes to establish a hotel and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To install water pipes at her business premise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wheat flour and a bicycle for transporting his goods.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.ar: اسمهان عمرها 53 سنة امرآة عزباء تعمل في بيع ادوات التنظيف والخشبيات والخياطة لها في عملها 15 سنة تحب العمل وتعتبره اولى اهتمامها هي امرآة مثابرة نشيطة ومحبة للعمل تعمل بجد ونشاط تريد دائما التطور والمثابرة في العمل لها عمل جيد ومميز في محيطها تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة ادوات تنظيف وخياطة وبيع بعض الخشبيات كان للقرض السابق من المجموعة الاثر الجيد في تطوير العمل وهي بحاجة لبعض المادة حتى تتمكن من تطوير العمل حيث انها تحلم بأن تقوم بافتتاح معرض خاص لعرض الخشبيات التي تبيعها وتستطيع ان تحسن من وضعها بفضل ذكائها في العمل وتمتلك مهارة في فتح عمل خاص بها لها زبائن من محيطها وجيرانها ومن الضيع المجاورة
texts.en: Asmahan is 53 years old and unmarried. She works selling cleaning materials, wooden furniture and textiles. She has been doing this for 15 years. She loves her work and considers it her foremost priority. She is a persistent, hard-working, and energetic who is always seeking to develop her business, which is distinguished in her locA. area. With this loan she wants to purchase new cleaning materials, textiles and furniture stock. The last loan had a good impact in developing her business, and she is now in need of some capitA. to develop further. She dreams of opening an exhibition to display the furniture she sells. She is able to improve her situation due to her intelligence in business and she possesses the necessary skills to open her own store. She has customers from her neighbours as well as her locA. and surrounding areas.

loans.use: to purchase new stock for her store and work towards opening an exhibition for her wooden furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and to renovate his business premise

loans.name: Lillian Auma

texts.en:
Lillian Auma is 32 years old married to Fredrick O..  She has been running her tailoring and retail shop for a period of about three years with an income of 10,500 Kenya shillings a month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a staff member.  She wants to use the loan to buy textile materials and stock of sugar, maize, rice, and beans for the retail shop.  She hopes to improve her family’s living standard and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy textile materials and stock of sugar, maize, rice, and beans for the retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a steamer and a hair dryer

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two school-age children. He has been working as a furniture painter for the past 10 years. In 2004, he started to work on a freelance basis upon client’s requests and he started to deal with some galleries. He has hired a part-time employee to assist him in completing the work tasks. He obtained his first Kiva loan and was a very good client with payments on time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional paint for his work. He has recently taken a new project and is willing to accomplish the work in a professional way. In the future, he is planning to expand his business operation by taking on bigger projects and building a good business reputation.

loans.use: to purchase additional paint for his work

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta W. is 29 years old and married to Lot Mwangi who contributes to the family income. They have two children aged 12,and three years old. For three years, she has been operating a company that deals with assorted stationary that she sells to her customers, earning an income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings a month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET by a staff member.  She wants to use the loan to buy stationery and pay for services in her company.  She hopes to grow her company to be a leading insurance agency in Thika.

loans.use: to buy stationery and pay for services in her company

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to reconstruct his barber shop building

loans.name: Paulina Wanjiku

texts.en: Pauline Wanjiku W. is 47 years old, married, and has two children. She has been running her dairy and crops farm for four years with an income of 24,000 KES a month.  This is Pauline's fourth loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying her previous loans in good time. She wants to use the loan to buy animal feeds and embark on poultry farming by buying chicks to rear and sell later at a profit. She hopes to own a bigger farm with poultry and livestock.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and chicks

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is 38 years old, married, and has two children.  She and her husband are both farmers who practice both animals and plants farming. This had been their business for a period of 10 years with an income of 13,000 KES every month. 

This will be Magdaline's first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a staff member. She wants to use her loan to buy farm inputs such as chicken feeds and fertilizers for the farm and especially, since the planting season has started. 

She hopes to own a greenhouse, see her children receive quality education and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as chicks feeds and fertilizer

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 36 years old, married and blessed with a six-year-old child.  He is a clinical officer by profession and runs St. John Medical Services.  It has been five years since he started the business and has employed one person.  He hopes to open a nursing home and a fully equipped theatre in the future.  He has requested 15,000 KES to pay school fees for his six-year-old child.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his child

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Matogoma

texts.fr:
Madame  Matogoma K.  est âgée de 30 ans, mariée  et résidant avec son époux à Lafiabougou, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Matogoma K. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité de couture il y onze années. Son atelier de couture se trouve non loin du nouveau marché de Médine où elle dispose déjà de 3 machines dont 2 machines de broderie et 1 machine simple. Madame Matogoma est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses services. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso quelque mois. Elle est à son premier prêt individuel qui lui permettra d’acheter des pièces de rechange pour ses trois machines et une partie pour payer des tissus pour les coudre et ensuite les revendre afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Matogoma K. is a 30-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in Lafiabougou, a district on the outskirts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After attempting several different activities without success, Matogoma K. was introduced to sewing 11 years ago. Her sewing shop is located near the new market of Médine, and she already has three machines, two for embroidery, and the other a standard machine. Mrs. Matogoma is in high demand for the quality of her services.

Wanting to better serve a steadily increasing clientele, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso a few months ago. This is her first individual loan, which she will use to buy spare parts for her three sewing machines. She will also buy fabrics to sew and sell. This will allow her to meet the needs of her growing customer base. 

With this loan, she expects to earn a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will be used primarily to cover family expenses, to pay the interest on the loan, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, and spare parts for her sewing and embroidery machines

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadia S. a 39 ans et vit avec son époux et ses 4 enfants à Kaboila I Natien, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Kadia S. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée aux activités de restauration et cela depuis plus de quinze ans. Elle mène son activité devant le domicile conjugal en face de l’ancienne Direction Régionale des Affaires Sociales, tous les jours, où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de quatre ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 11ème prêt individuel, tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce onzième prêt, elle compte acheter,  5 sacs de pomme de terre, 5 paquets de cube maggi, 3 bidons de vinaigre, 40 sachets d’Attièkè,  35kg de viande de bœuf,  50kg de poissons frais, 5 litres d’huile alimentaire,  3 sacs de charbon de bois, des miches de pain, des bananes plantain (Aloko), etc. Elle achète ses marchandises sur place et effectue ses ventes au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée très généralement des jeunes (célibataires) surtout d'employers  de commerce puisque sa place n’est pas loin du marché où il se trouve des magasins de stock de céréales. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour les dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadia S. is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and four children in Kaboila I Natien, in the center of the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). After having tried many business activities without success, over 15 years ago Mrs. Kadia S. decided to start cooking food for sale. She sells by their family home, in front of the former Regional Office for Social Affairs, every day.  Her business is very popular with customers because of the high quality of her products.

In order to meet the growing customer demand, over four years ago she decided to turn ot the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. After several solidarity loans (group loans) under the auspices of the local women’s association, she is now on her 11th individual loan. All her prior loans have been duly repaid.

With this 11th loan, she plans to buy five bags of potatoes, five packs of “Maggi” bouillon cubes, three jugs of vinegars, 40 packs of “attieke” (a traditional manioc-based dish), 35 kg of beef, 50 kg of fresh fish, five liters of vegetable oil, three bags of charcoal, bread loaves, plantains etc. She buys her wares locally and sells for cash and on credit to a customer base composed generally of young (unmarried) people, mostly vendors, as she is based near the area where cereal warehouses are located. She plans to achieve a monthly income of 300,000 West African Francs, which will be used mainly for covering family expenses and paying the interest on her loan, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-serving business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter was born in 1968.  He is married and is a father of three children.  He has been quarrying for three years.  Before he started the business, Peter was a farmer.  Through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya, he has learned a lot about financial management.  This has helped him better budget his money.   Peter is requesting a loan for 10,000 Kes to hire more space for quarrying and to buy quarrying tools.

loans.use: To rent land for quarrying and buy quarrying tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy traditional African fabrics (embroidered, "pagne wax" and damask-type "bazins")

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a resident of Nkubu inCentral Kenya where he has been farming for five years.  He is married and has 2 children, aged 11 and 4.   His farm produces beans, maize, bananas and milk. He hires two farmhands.  Nicholas also earns additional income from his employment as a driver.  

Nicholas has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to venture into pig farming.  He says this business will help him educate his children as well as provide them with basic needs, like food. He hopes to grow his farm faster and become fully commercial.

He praises Juhudi for its agricultural loan provisions.

loans.use: to buy piglets to start a pig farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install sanitary wares and tiles in the bathroom

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy equipment for her husband's motorcycle repair shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man from Lebanon living with his parents and three siblings. He has been working as a freelance farmer since 2007. He owns diverse farming machinery, equipment, and tractors and there are lots of land owners asking for his skilled services (such as excavation, farming, harvesting etc). Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his agricultural tools in order to offer better services to his clients. He estimates that with the coming years, his profits will increase.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his agricultural equipment

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Bakary B. est âgé de 47 ans, polygame et père de huit enfants (4 garçons et 4 filles). Il vit avec ses deux femmes et ses enfants à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, il s’est vite initiée aux activités de commercialisation des engrais,  de pesticides et d’insecticides depuis plus de vingt  ans. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et reçoit beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins font défaut.  C’est ainsi, qu’il sollicita ce quatrième prêt,  pour acheter 10 sacs d’engrais urées, 9 sacs de complexe coton et 7 sacs de complexe maïs afin de pouvoir satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre. Ces trois prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Il s’approvisionne auprès du représentant de TOGUNA (une usine de fabrique d’engrais) à Sikasso dans son magasin au nouveau marché de Médine Sikasso. Avec une clientèle composée d’agriculteurs certains de ses clients payent au comptant, d’autre à crédit.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Bakary B. is 47 years old, polygamous, and father with eight children (four boys and four girls). He lives with his two wives and his children in Hamdallaye, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having had the chance to attend school, he quickly became familiar with marketing fertilizers, pesticides, and insecticides over twenty years ago. With such experience in this domain, he enjoys a good reputation and receives many orders. But he is short of the resources necessary to satisfy his needs. Thus, he requested this fourth loan to buy 10 sacks of urea, 9 sacks of cotton fertilizer, and 7 sacks of corn fertilizer in order to satisfy the demand from his ever-growing customer base. The three previous loans have been properly repaid.

Bakary is supplied from representatives of TOUNA (a fertilizer factory) in Sikasso in his store at the new market of Médine Sikasso. With a customer base composed of farmers, some of them pay with cash, others with credit. 

With this loan, Bakary envisions making a monthly profit of 250,000 francs CFA. Once the profits are in hand, he plans on resolving most of his expenses and his family's, as well as to cover the loan interest and to invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married lady with two children.  She runs a salon and has been engaged in this business for two years.  She has one employee.  Her business is located in a slum area, hence most of her customers are low-income earners.  In the future, she hopes to own a business premise instead of paying rent, which is costly.  Esther has requested a loan for 10,000 Kes to buy hair braids and weaves.

loans.use: To buy hair braids and weaves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a shop in a good location

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is 34 years old, married and has two children, aged 5 and 8.  He has a motorbike (bodaboda) transport business. He has been in this  business for three years.  He says that he has sustained his business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes that one day he will own several motorbikes and employ people.  With this loan for 90,000 Kes, he will buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Nabil

texts.ar: نبيل عمره 24 سنة متزوج وله ولد يعمل في صالون تزيين رجالي له في عمله 11 سنة يحب عمله ويستطيع ان يطوره وان يزيد من زبائن بفضل ذكائه وعمله المبتكر يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجوعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة وتغيير ديكور المحل حتى يتمكن من زيادة عدد الزبائن له مهارة كبيرة  وخبرة في عمله لكن ما يعيق تقدم العمل عنده هو النقص في رأس المال يطمح بأن يفتتح مصلحة جديدة له وهي تأجير السيارات له زبائن من جيرانه واقاربه وهو يلقى دعم كبير من عائلته التي تشجعه على التطور والتقدم في العمل وفي خطة تحسين المستقبل
texts.en: Nabil is 24 years old and married with a son. He works in a barber shop and has been doing this for 11 years. He loves his work and can develop it and increase the number of clients due to his intelligence and his innovative work. With this loan he wants to purchase new stock and change the décor of his shop so that he can attract more customers. He has experience and skill in his work but is impeded by lack of financiA. capitA.. He also aspires to open a new car hire business. He has customers from his neighbours and relatives and has the full support of his family who encourage him to develop and progress for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase new stock and improve the décor of his barber shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new hairdressing tools and beauty products

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis is 26 years old, married, and blessed with a six-year-old child.  He sells fruits to earn a living for his family. He started this business three years ago and has employed two people.  His business has really grown since he joined Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to open other outlets for his business in the future.  Denis needs 80,000 Kes to buy apples, oranges, bananas, and utensils for serving fruit salad.

loans.use: To buy fruits and utensils for serving fruit salad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Bazirengedde Development Group

texts.en: 39-year-old Teddy K.'s philosophy is that hard work pays. Her relentless diligence has indeed played very much in her favour as she goes about her 8-year-old business, which is charcoal  sales. She operates her business from Kigombya-Mukono. This happily married mother of 4 says she was influenced by her husband to have a hand in this business. Prior to that, Teddy says she was selling mostly tomatoes. Weekly, she says her profits are 90,000 Ugandan shillings.  She says with this loan she is going to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to resell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.ar: ابراهيم عمره 41 سنة متزوج وهو اب لخمس اولاد يعمل في نقل الطلاب والسواح له في عمله 12 سنة يحب عمله ويريد التطور والتقدم فيه فهو اب حنون يريد ان يؤمن لأولاده العيش الجيد الكريم وتعليمهم بشكل جيد لذلك يسعى جاهدا الى تطوير عمله وتحسينه يريد ان يعتمد على مجهوده حتى يزيد من مدخوله ولكن ما يعيق تطوره هو النقص في رأس المال لذلك يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى صيانة الفان خاصته قبل الموسم السياحي حتى يتمكن من مراعاة جميع المناطق التي يتنقل بها وخاصة انه هو مصدر الرزق الوحيد الذي يعتمد عليه في دفع المصاريف والحاجات اليومية للعائلة وللعمل
texts.en: Ibrahim is a 41 year old married father of five children. He works as a driver transporting students and tourists, which he has been doing for 12 years. He wants to develop and progress his business as he is a compassionate father who wants to secure a good comfortable standard of living and education for his children. He wants to be independent and increase his income but is held back by lack of financial capital. With this loan he wants to perform maintenance work on his van, particularly before the tourist season, so that he can travel to all the areas that he needs to transport people to. This is important as it is the sole source of income for him, which he depends upon to pay for his family's daily needs and expenses.

loans.use: to perform maintenance work on his van ahead of the tourist season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a better model taxi to attract more loyal customers.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 51-year-old mother of nine daughters and three sons. Mariam's daughters and sons are between the ages of 11 and 31 years old. Some of them have graduated already and started work, while the rest are school students.

Mariam and her husband can finally move to a house with enough rooms for their big family. Mariam took out a loan from FATEN to purchase kitchen items such as a kitchen table, wardrobes, chairs, etc., as well as to paint the house.

Mariam's husband, Mahmoud, is photographed instead as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to paint the house and finish the kitchen.

loans.name: Salem

texts.ar: سالم له من العمر 54 سنة متزوج وهو اب 3 اولاد يعمل في الحدادة الافرنجية (الفرفورجيه)له في عمله 35 سنة يحب عمله وهو مميز به كثيرا حيث انه مقصد لمعظم زبائنه اذ يتميز عمله بالدقة والابتكار والاسعار المدروسة له زبائن من المحيط والجيران وغيره ولكن ما يعيق تقدمه في العمل ومواكبة ما هو جديد من عدة وغيره هو النقص في رأس المال حيث انه يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء عدة جديدة للعمل و شراء مولد كهرباء للعمل وقد واجه بعض الصعوبات المادية ولكن بفضل الخبرة الكبيرة في العمل والرغبة في التقدم ادة الى تحسين الوضع طموح يسعى الى امتلاك عمل خاص ثاني يؤدي الى زيادة المدخول
texts.en: Salem is a 54 year old married father of three children. He works as a blacksmith and has 35 years experience. He loves his work, is very distinguished in it and is the sole service provider for most of his customers. He is known for his precision, innovative work and reasonable prices. He has customers from his local area and his neighbours, but his progress and his ability to keep up new developments is impeded by lack of financial capital. With this loan he wants to purchase new tools to work with, and a new electricity generator. He has faced a number of financial difficulties but due to his vast experience and desire for progress he aspires to own a second business in order to help increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase new tools to work with and a new electricity generator.

loans.name: Pempa

texts.en:
Pempa O. O. is a 41-year-old married father of five children.  He has been a mixed farmer in Narok for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client  in his area.  Pempa is requesting his first loan in order to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and chemicals. He intends to use the returns from the loan both to reinvest in farming and to repay the loan.

An industrious man who will work hard to achieve his goals, Pempa dreams of becoming a famous farmer in his area and enabling his children to attain a high level of education.

loans.use: to purchase inputs for his farm

loans.name: Perfect Development Group

texts.en: 30-year-old G. Saua has been engaged in a motorcycle transportation business in Kalagi-Mukono for the last five years. This father of two says he joined this business influenced by his close friends. Before that, he was plying a clothes sales enterprise. Hard work and determination are the two factors which have seen him make strides. Weekly, out of this lucrative business, Saua says he makes profit to the tune of 160,000 shillings, and he says with this loan he is going to purchase another motorbike. He says with another motorbike, he will be able to increase his daily income.

loans.use: to purchase another motorbike.

loans.name: Tonke Ole

texts.en: Tonke Ole O., age 44, is married with six children. He has been trading animals for the last eleven years. He was introduced to KADET by a registered client in his domicile. This is his first loan, which he has planned to use to purchase some goats and sheep to sell for a profit. He intends to use the returns from the loan to expand his business, educate his children and, partly, to repay the loan. His dreams are to be the best, well known businessman in the area and to educate his children to a higher level of education. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase some goats and sheep to sell for a profit.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia C. T. is 43 years old.  She is married and is a mother of four children.  Sophia has been a mixed farmer for the last fifteen years. 

Sophia was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client.  She has applied for her first loan which she is planning to use to buy farm inputs and  animals for fattening. She hopes to use the profit from this loan to reinvest back into her business. 

Her hopes and dream is to become a great farmer. She is a brisk woman who is dedicated to her work and who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy inputs for her farm

loans.name: Khaled

texts.ar: خالد في عمر 48 سنة متزوج وهو اب 3 اولاد يعمل منذ 20 سنة في الحدادة الافرنجية (فرفورجيه)يتميز عمله بالدقة والاسعار الجيدة والدقة في العمل والتطور وملاحقة كل ما هو جديد فهو طموح يسعى الى تأمين مصدر رزق جيد له ولأولاده وخاصة انه يعلمهم وهم مسؤوليته يريد تعليم اولاده بشكل جيد وتربيتهم ويسعى من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة حديد وتأمين سيولة للمحل اكثر ما يطمح اليه هو تقوية مصلحته وتطويرها
texts.en: Khaled is 48 years old and married with three children. He has been working as a blacksmith for 20 years. He is distinguished for his good prices, his precision in his work, and his pursuit of new developments. He is ambitious and aspires to secure a good source of income for himself and his children. He particularly wants to, and is responsible for providing them with a good education and upbringing. With this loan he wants to purchase new stock and iron he may need, and most of all he wants to support and develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase new stock and iron, and most of all to support and develop his business.

loans.name: Kasanje Twegate Group

texts.en:
Suyina N. is a 46-year-old enterprising business woman who has been plying a charcoal sales business in Mbiko-Lugazi for the past 18 years. Before that, this happily married mother of 8 was operating a food vending business. 

N. is a hardworking, sturdy and determined lady whose chances for future success look to be in the ascendancy every passing year. Weekly, she says her profits are 100,000 shillings. N. says she is going to use proceeds from this loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: to purchase of more charcoal to resell

loans.name: Stephen Kiarie

texts.en:
Stephen Kiarie is a 29-year-old single businessman. He supports his parents and has been running his motorcycle transport business for a period of two years, earning an income of 10,000 kenya shillings a month.

This is Stephen's first loan cycle from KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET by a staff member. He wants to use the loan to service his motorcycle.   He hopes to expand his business and improve his living standard.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more timber to resell

loans.name: Youssef

texts.ar: يوسف عمره26 سنة اعزب يعمل في بيع وصيانة المولدات الكهربائيةو مقويات الكهرباء الاتوماتكيةله في عمله سنتين يحب عمله ويريد التطور دائما به من خلال تجديد المحل وصيانته وشراء بضاعة جديدة يريد ان يؤمن مستقبله حتى يتمكن من بناء عائلة وخاصة انه متكفل بوالده ووالدته فهو محب للعائلة انساني وطموح بأن تفضل عائلته متماسكة انه انسان يحب العمل ويريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة وتركيب زجاج المينيوم للمحل يتميز عمله بالدقة والجودة والانفراد في المحيط حيث انه يريد ايضا ان يزيد من مدخوله حتى يتمكن من بيع ايضا الغسالات والبرادات وتصليح الادوات الكهربائية له زبائن من المحيط والجيران وهو يحب هذا العمل منذ صغره ويطمح بأن يمتلك محل اوسع ويصبح مؤسسة تجارية
texts.en: Youssef is 26 years old and unmarried. He works in the sale and maintenance of electricity generators and automatic generators. He has been doing this for 2 years. He works hard and with precision, and his business is unique in his local area. He wants to develop his business by renewing his shop and by purchasing new stock. He wants to secure a good future for himself so that he is able to settle down with his own family. He is also supports his parents as he is caring and and comes from a close-knit family. He loves his work and with this loan he wants to purchase new stock and renovate his shop. He wants to increase his income so that he can purchase washing machines, refrigerators, and repair electrical appliances. He has customers from amongst his neighbours and his local area. He has loved this line of work since he was young and aspires to own a bigger store and become a commercial enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase new stock and renovate his shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 52-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three children. He has 25 years of experience working in the food and beverage domain. And in 2008, after this extensive experience, he opened his own cafeteria. During those years, this older man was able to have an increasing number of clients who helped him achieve greater income. This will be his second Kiva loan. We note that he has a very good repayment history. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase supplementary materials and equipment needed for his cafeteria. He will also renovate his shop in order to attract more clients and earn superior income.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary materials and equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics products to resell

loans.name: Pelila Ole

texts.en:
Pelila Ole O. is 39 years old.  He is married and has three children. He has been in the animal trading business for the last four years.

Pelila Ole O. was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client in his area of residence. This is his first loan, which he plans to use to purchase some goats and sheep for fattening and sale for a profit. He intends to use the returns from this loan to expand his business as well as to repay the loan.  

His dream is to be the best and well known businessman in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: buy goats and sheep for raise and sell

loans.name: Dahir Abdi

texts.en:
Dahir Abdi is 36 years old.  He is married to Halimah, who helps in his restaurant. He has been running his restaurant business for a period of about five years and earns an income of 5,000 Kenyan shillings a month. 

This is Dahir Abdi's first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET by a group member. He wants to use this loan to buy wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil to be used in his restaurant.

He hopes to expand his business and improve the living standard for his family.

loans.use: to buy flour and cooking oil

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John G. is a 26-year-old single businessman. He has been running his motorcycle transport business for a period of two years and earns an income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings a month.

This is John's first loan from KADET LTD.  He wants to use it to buy a piece of land. He hopes to own rental houses and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land

loans.name: Nhlanzeko Group

texts.en:
Ncamisile is 28 years old.  She is single and has 2 children who are 6 and 10 years old. She runs a retail business in Mandeni in Kwa Zulu Natal, South Africa. In the photo, Ncamisile is standing on the far left, wearing a dress with pink flowers.

Ncamisile has been running her business for 1 year and sells clothing, underwear, and face cloths in the area. She also receives income from a government child support grant. She says that the main challenges to her business are customers who buy on credit and fail to pay on time.

Ncamisile requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses to buy clothes and cosmetics. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her renovate her house. In the future, she would like to own a shop where she can sell her products.

In her comments she adds that WDB has been a help to them because they receives loans that they are able to pay back.

loans.use: To buy clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.ar: محمد عمره 37 سنة متزوج وهو اب لولدان يعمل في زراعة الارض ونقل الرمل له في عمله 15 سنة يحب العمل ويرى فيه المتعة لأنه يرى ان زراعة الارض هي اهم الاعمال , يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء سيارة لستعمالها في نقل المواد لزراعة الارض يسعى الى زيادة المدخول وخاصة انه كان عامل واصبح لديه عمله الخاص حيث تمكن من ان يزيد من مدخوله فهو يمتلك الخبرة الكبيرة التي خولته ان يؤمن عمل خاص به زبائنه هم من اهالي البلدة والمزارعين يسعى الى تأمين مستقبل جيد له ولعائلته خاصة انه في طور تأسيس عائلة
texts.en: Mohamad is 37 years old and married with two children. He works in agriculture and transports sand. He has been doing this for 15 years and loves his work. He enjoys what he does as he believes that cultivation of the land is the most important work. With this loan he wants to buy a vehicle to help his work. He aspires to increase his income as he used to just be a worker but now owns his own business. He has the necessary experience for his own business and he has customers both from the city and from agricultural areas. He aspires to secure a good future for himself and his family, especially since he is in the midst of establishing his family.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle to use in the transportation of sand and agricultural materials.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has owned an insurance office since 2000 with 15 years of previous experience in the same occupation. He offers his clients different kinds of insurance (life insurance, health insurance, car insurance, etc.) He cooperates with his brothers to handle the heavy living expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renovate his office and modernize it so that he can receive his clients properly. In the future, he is looking to further expand his business and increase his capital.

loans.use: to renovate his office and modernize it

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 35 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. Connie has a small retail shop business, which she has run for three years. She also has a second business of tobacco farming. 
To help expand her business, Connie has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as soap, for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Connie hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Connie hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as soap, for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her acreage for farming

loans.name: Fatima

texts.ar: فاطمه عمرها 60 سنة هي ام متزوجة ولها 5 اولاد  تعيش في منطقة في البقاع اللبناني تعمل في حياكة السجاد ولها في عملها 15 سنة تحب عملها تحب ان تعلم اولادها هذه المهنة حيث انها تقول ان هذه المهنة معرضة للأنقراض في بنات الجيل الجديد لذلك تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مواد اولية لدعم هذه المصلحة وتطويرها حيث انها من التراث تواجه من بعض الصعوبات المادية التي تعيق تطوير هذه المصلحة فهي نشيطة ومتطورة ودائمة العمل حتى تتمكن من تأمين العيش الجيد لها ولعائلتها
texts.en: Fatima is 60 years old and married with five children. She lives in the Lebanese Beqaa region where she weaves carpets for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She loves her works and loves to teach her children the skill, saying that the art is in danger of becoming extinct in the new generation. With this loan she wants to purchase primary raw materials to support her work and develop it. She is part of a heritage that is facing financial difficulties thereby hindering the development of her business. She is energetic and is always seeking to develop her work so that she may secure a good standard of living for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for carpet weaving.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more produce and goats for business expansion.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. runs a shop in Besease Village, near Elmina town, where she sells slippers. 

Married to a farmer, she has three children. Esi’s income pays for some of the household expenses. 

She wishes to grow her business and intends to use her loan to purchase more slippers for sale. She will reinvest some of the additional profits and save up the rest for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for sale.

loans.name: Simon Kaila

texts.en:
Simon Kaila O. N. is 34 years old. He is married to Mary N. and they have two children. His monthly income is 5,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He has been a farmer for the past 10 years. Farming is doing well is his area due to favorable conditions.

He learned about KADET LTD through advertisement done by KADET. He has been a good client who repays his loans well. He has applied for his third loan of KES.80,000 from KADET LTD with which he plans to buy farm supplies. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to plow back into the farm. 

He has never borrowed from any other MFI (microfinance institution). He is an honest man who will achieve if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en:
Abenawa A. is married to a farmer and they have four children. 

Abenawa has been a petty trader in the village of Besease (near Elmina) for the past two years. She sells items like shea butter, powder, steel wool and soap. Her income helps pay for some of the household expenses. 

In order to grow her business, Abenawa needs a loan from Kiva to purchase more shea butter and steel wool to increase her sales. She plans to save up any additional income for her children’s future education.

loans.use: Abenawa needs a loan from Kiva to purchase more shea butter and powder to increase her sales.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
For the past 10 years, Ama K. has been selling shea butter and powder. She plies her trade in Besease Village (near the fishing town of Elmina) the traditional way, carrying her wares around on her head. 

Ama is married to a farmer and they have five children. Her income helps to pay for some of the household expenses. She wants to save up for her children’s education and she wants to expand her business. She will use her loan to purchase larger quantities of powder and shea butter, which she hope will increase her sales. Any additional profits she earns will be reinvested into her business and set aside for her children’s future.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of powder and shea butter, which she hope will increase her sales.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua B. is a widow. She has four children. As the family’s sole breadwinner, she earns her income by selling food items such as cowpeas (as shown in the photograph). She is keen to expand her business and will use her loan to purchase more cowpeas, ripe plantain and palm oil. She hopes this will increase her sales. Additional profits will be reinvested back into her business. 

Ekua has been in her current business for the past 2 years and she plies her trade in Besease Village, which is near the fishing town of Elmina.

loans.use: to purchase more cowpeas, ripe plantain and palm oil.

loans.name: Mugisa

texts.en:
Mugisa H. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Mugisa has a small retail shop business, which he has run for one year. He also has a second business transporting goods.
To help expand his business, Mugisa has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Mugisa hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Mugisa hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald S. is 34 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Gerald has an electrical appliances sales business, which he has run for two years.
To help expand his business, Gerald has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more electrical goods for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Gerald hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical goods for resale.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim B. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Ibrahim has a small retail shop business, which he has run for over ten years. He also has a second business operating a video hall.
To help expand his business, Ibrahim has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as maize flour, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Ibrahim hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as maize flour, for resale.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret K. is 29 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Gorret has a bar, which she has run for six years.
To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drinks, such as soda beer, for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Gorret hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks, such as soda beer, for resale.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva K. is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Eva has a produce business, which she has run for less than one year.
To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more produce for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Eva hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more produce for resale.

loans.name: Kidemi Turpesio

texts.en:
Kidemi Turpesio N., 27-year old, single, and supports his parents. He has been a farmer for the past four years, with a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

Kidemi was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member. He paid his first loan back well and he applied for his second loan, which he will use to buy farm inputs. 

With the profits generated, he plans to expand his farming efforts and venture into a livestock keeping business. He dreams to be rich. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more, despite limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Wakiso Women's Group

texts.en:
34 year old Teopista K. owns a retail shop in Wakiso trading center-Lugazi. She has been in charge of this shop for the past 18 years. She says that, to get established she relied on savings from her grocery business. 

This business has enabled her to support her family of 6, plus her husband. The experience she has garnered in the course of the past 18 years, she says, is pivotal. This is true, not only now, but will also be of paramount importance in the near future. Monthly, Teopista says her business generates her 300,000 shillings, as sales revenue. 

With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more general merchandise retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more general merchandise retail commodities to resell.

loans.name: Ntungamo Kwetungura Group

texts.en: M. Lauben is the leader of the Ntungamo Kwetungura group in Ntungamo. He is 34 years old and married with five children. Four of the children are still in school. Lauben is into the business of selling produce like beans, millet and coffee from Ntungamo. He sells mostly to locals. Hard work and being social have enabled him to succeed. He is able to generate 200,000/= monthly after a long period of seven years in business. A friend introduced him to the business and his dream is to be able to educate his children as well as buy farm land. He has been able to buy cows for his kraal (an enclosure for livestock). He needs a loan to be able to buy more produce and a cow for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more produce and a cow

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein S. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Hussein has a bricklaying business, which he has run for five years. He also has a second business running a retail shop.
To help expand his business, Hussein has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a machine that mixes soil to make bricks for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Hussein hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a machine that mixes soil to make bricks for resale.

loans.name: Nayavesupat Enole

texts.en:
Nayavesupat Enole N. is 45 years old and married with five children. She is a businesswoman who has been operating a food kiosk for the past five years.
